column10: Mr. Inge G. Thulin has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of 3M Company since February 24, 2012. Mr. Thulin served as an Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer of 3M Company from May 1, 2011 to February 24, 2012. Mr. Thulin served as an Executive Vice President of International Operations of 3M Company from September 12, 2003 to May 1, 2011. He served as a Vice President of Europe and Middle East of 3M Company Operations from 2002 to 2003, Division ... Vice President of Skin Health Division from 2000 to 2002, General Manager of Skin Health Division from 1999 to 2000 and Marketing Operations Director of Skin Health Division from 1998 to 1999. Mr. Thulin served as Skin Health Business Unit Director of Skin Health Division since 1997; Managing Director of 3M Russia since 1995; European Business Unit Manager of Surgical Devices, 3M Europe since 1993; Business Manager of Vision Care and Orthopedic Products, 3M Europe since 1991; Group Manager of Life Sciences Sector, 3M Sweden since 1987 and various Sales & Marketing positions of 3M Sweden since 1979. He has been the Chairman of 3M Company since June 1, 2012. He serves as a Member of the Board of Trustees, United States Council for International Business. He has been a Director of 3M Company since February 8, 2012. He served as a Member of the International Programs Advisory Council at the Carlson School of Management. He served as a Director for The Council for the United States and Italy. Mr. Thulin served as a Director of Toro Co. from September 18, 2007 to March 2012. column10: Mr. Miles D. White has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Abbott Laboratories Limited since 1999. Mr. White joined Abbott in 1984. column10: Mr. Pierre Nanterme has been the Chief Executive Officer of Accenture Plc since January 1, 2011. Mr. Nanterme is responsible for managing and driving the annual business performance of the company, formulating and executing long-term strategies, and interacting with clients, employees, investors and other stakeholders. He is Accenture���s primary decision- and policy-maker, setting the tone for the company���s values, ethics and culture. He serves on the executive board of Policy working group. the B20 Green Growth Action Alliance, is co-chair of its Energy Efficiency working group and was previously a member of its Economic He is a proven leader with deep expertise in developing strong client relationships, a passion for building outstanding client teams and a disciplined focus on operations and execution. He served as the Group Chief Executive of Financial Services Operating Group at Accenture Plc from September 1, 2007 to December 31, 2010. He served as Group Chief Executive of Financial Services at Accenture (UK) Limited since September 2007. column3: Executive Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of Executive Committee,
column10: Ms. Patricia A. Woertz, also known as Pat, has been the Chief Executive Officer at Archer Daniels Midland Company since May 1, 2006. Ms. Woertz serves as the Chief Executive Officer at ADM Alliance Nutrition, Inc. She served as the President of Archer Daniels Midland Company since May 1, 2006. She focuses on extending the Archer-Daniels-Midland's strong financial momentum and accelerating the growth of its BioEnergy business while expanding its premier position in the ... agricultural processing value chain. She has a diverse background and breadth of experience. She joined Archer-Daniels-Midland Co. in April 2006. She worked at oil company, Chevron Corp., where she spent 29 years and served as its Executive Vice President of Global Downstream in charge of operations that included refining, marketing, lubricant, supply and trading businesses in 180 countries since 2001. She served as President of Chevron Products Co., its U.S. refining and fuels marketing company. She served as Vice President at Chevron Corp. since 1998. She joined Ernst & Young in Pittsburgh as a Certified Public Accountant. In 1977, She joined Gulf Oil Corp. in Pittsburgh and served positions in refining and marketing, strategic planning, and finance. In 1981, She transferred to Houston to Head a U.S. upstream audit group. From 1985 to 1987, during the merger of Gulf and Chevron, she worked on asset divestitures as part of the debt-reduction process. Since 1989, she served as Finance Manager of Chevron Information Technology Co. Since 1991, She served as Chevron Corp.'s Strategic Planning Manager and was responsible for evaluating strategies for both its planning committee and its management committee, both of which she served as Secretary. She served as the President of Chevron Canada Ltd. (CCL) since October 1993, a wholly owned subsidiary of Chevron Corp. Since January 1996, she served as President of Chevron International Oil Company, a subsidiary of Chevron Corp. and Vice President of logistics and trading for Chevron Products Co. and was responsible for supply and distribution and worldwide trading. She is an internationally recognized business leader, working frequently with government officials, heads of state, business partners and community stakeholders across the globe. She has been the Executive Chairperson at Archer Daniels Midland Company since February 2007 and its Executive Director since May 1, 2006. She has been Director at Procter & Gamble Co., since January 8, 2008. She serves on the Board of Directors of American Petroleum Institute, the Board of Trustees of the University of San Diego in California, as well as the Board of Visitors of Pennsylvania State University. In 2000, Fortune magazine named Ms. Woertz one of the top ten most powerful women in business. In 2005, she was named a Distinguished Alumna by Pennsylvania State University. Ms. Woertz graduated in 1974 with a BS in Accounting from Pennsylvania State University. column10: Mr. Timothy M. Ring, also known as Tim, has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer at CR Bard Inc. since August 8, 2003. In 1999, Mr. Ring was named Group President at Bard Electrophysiology and Peripheral Vascular Products and in 2002 was given additional responsibility for Bard Access Systems, Bard Europe, and Corporate Healthcare Services. Corporate Healthcare, Peripheral Vascular, Access Systems, and Electrophysiology Divisions as well as for all Bard's businesses in Europe, the Middle East, and Africa until August 2003. He joined CR Bard Inc. in 1992 as a Corporate Vice President of Human Resources. In November 1995, Mr. Ring was given additional responsibility for Interventional Cardiology and Electrophysiology. In January 1997, he also resumed additional responsibility for the Cardiac Assist and Cardiopulmonary divisions and in April 1997 was promoted to Group President at Coronary Vascular Products. Prior to this, Mr. Ring was employed at Abbott Laboratories for nearly 10 years, last as the Director of Personnel for the Hospital Products Division. During 1990, he was General Manager at Abbott in the Australian, New Zealand and Indonesian operations. From 1987 to 1989, he was a Director of Personnel for Pacific, Asia, Africa, and Europe. In 1984 to 1986, Mr. Ring served as Director of Personnel for Latin America and South East Asia. Mr. Ring was an Assistant Personnel Manager for the Pharmaceutical Division at Abbott, when he joined in 1983. He was employed at The General Motors Corporation, which he joined after graduation. column3: Chief Executive Officer, President and Director,
column10: Mr. Hubert Joly has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Best Buy Co., Inc. since September 2012. Mr. Joly served as the President of Carlson Hotels Worldwide and Chief Executive Officer of Carlson Hotels Worldwide for RADLAX Gateway Hotel, LLC. Mr. Joly served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of CW Government Travel, Inc. since 2008. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Carlson Hotels Worldwide Inc. from March 1, 2008 to ... September 2012. Mr. Joly served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Carlson Companies Inc., and Carlson Rezidor Hotel Group from March 1, 2008 to August 2012. Mr. Joly served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of P. Lawson Travel since July 2004. He founded Carlson Companies (formerly, Gold Bond Stamp Company) in 1938. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Carlson Wagonlit B.V from July 2004 to April 2008. He was a consultant and then a partner of McKinsey & Company from 1982 to 1996. As a partner, he was specialized in the high-tech sector. Mr. Joly served as an Executive Vice President of Monitoring of US Assets of Vivendi Universal from August 2002 to June 30, 2004. He served as the Deputy Chief Financial Officer of Vivendi Universal (alternate name Vivendi) since April 2003. Mr. Joly served as a Member of the Executive Team of Vivendi Universal. Mr. Joly served as an Executive Vice President and Group Chief Information Officer of Vivendi Universal from November 2001 to November 2002. From December 2000 to October 2001, Mr. Joly was responsible for the integration of Vivendi Universal's North American activities. From July 1999 to June 2001, Mr. Joly served as the Chief Executive Officer of Havas Interactive, (known today as Vivendi Universal Games), Vivendi Universal's interactive entertainment and educational software publishing division. Mr. Joly worked in the technology sector from 1996 to 1999 as Vice President of Electronic Data Systems (EDS) Europe and president of EDS France. He served as the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of EDS France. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Carlson Wagonlit Travel Canada from 2004 to 2008. He spent 12 years at McKinsey & Company Inc. Mr. Joly has global responsibility for CWT business around the world. He has vast experience and expertise in hospitality and customer service. Mr. Joly served as the Chairman of The Rezidor Hotel Group from April 2011 to September 13, 2012. He served as the Chairman of the Board of North America of Carlson Wagonlit Travel Canada since January 2009 until August 17, 2012. He served as Vice Chairman of The Rezidor Hotel Group since 2008 until April 2011. He has been a Director of Ralph Lauren Corp. since June 30, 2009. He has been a Director of Best Buy Co. Inc. since September 2012. He serves on the Boards of the Minneapolis Institute of Arts, the Minnesota Business Partnership, World Travel and Tourism Council and the American Chamber of Commerce in France. He serves as a member of the supervisory board of the Aspen Institute France. He has been a Director of Ralph Lauren Corporation since June 30, 2009. He served as a Director of The Rezidor Hotel Group from 2008 to September 13, 2012 and Carlson Hotels Worldwide, Inc. since March 2008. He served as a Director of Carlson Companies Inc. of Park Inn Houston North Hotel & Conference Center since March 1, 2008. column3: Chief Executive Officer and Director,
column10: Dr. George A. Scangos, Ph.D. has been the Chief Executive Officer at Biogen Idec Inc., since June 2010. Dr. Scangos served as President and Chief Executive Officer at Exelixis Inc., a holding company of X-ceptor Therapeutics, Inc. from October 1996 to July 2010. He served as the President of Biotechnology of Bayer Corporation from September 1993 to October 1996 and was responsible for 1,100 employees in research and development, business development, process development, ... manufacturing, engineering, and quality assurance. He spent 10 years at Bayer Corporation. He joined Bayer in 1987 as a staff scientist. At Bayer, he served in several positions, including Senior Vice President of Research and Development for Bayer's pharmaceutical division and then President of Bayer Biotechnology. He has nearly 25 years of experience in the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries. Dr. Scangos served as the Chairman of Anadys Pharmaceuticals Inc. since December 31, 2005. He serves as the Vice Chairman of California Healthcare Institute (CHI). He has been a Director of Exelixis, Inc. since October 1996. He serves as a Director at BayBio. He has been a Director of Biogen Idec Inc. since June 2010. He has been an Independent Director of Anadys Pharmaceuticals Inc. since October 2003. He serves as a Director of The Global Alliance for TB Drug Development. He served as a Director of Symphony Evolution, Inc. Dr. Scangos served as a Non Executive Director of Entelos, Inc. since September 1997. Dr. Scangos served as a Director of Onyx Pharmaceuticals, Inc. from June 2000 to March 2005. He serves as an Adjunct Professor of Biology at Johns Hopkins University. He previously was a Professor of Biology at Johns Hopkins University for six years. He serves as a Director of Foundation Sante. He serves on the Board of Visitors at the University of California, San Francisco School of Pharmacy, the Board of Overseers at the University of California, Davis Medical School. He was a Jane Coffin Childs Postdoctoral Fellow in the laboratory of Frank Ruddle at Yale University. Dr. Scangos holds a B.A. in Biology from Cornell University and a Ph.D. in Microbiology from the University of Massachusetts. manufacturing, engineering, and quality assurance. column10: Mr. Laurence Douglas Fink, also known as Larry, serves as an Executive Officer at PNC Financial Services Group Inc. Mr. Fink serves as Chief Executive Officer of BlackRock Institutional Management Corporation and Blackrock Advisors Holdings, Inc. Mr. Fink has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of BlackRock Inc. since 1998. Mr. Fink serves as the Chief Executive at Private National Mortgage Acceptance Company LLC. He served as the Chairman and Chief Executive ... Officer of BlackRock Advisors Inc. Mr. Fink served as the Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of Balckrock Advisors, LLC. He founded BlackRock in 1988. He served as Managing Director and Co-Head of the Taxable Fixed Income Division at The First Boston Corporation, where he joined in 1976. Mr. Fink started the financial futures and options department and headed the mortgage and real estate products group. Mr. Fink was instrumental in the creation and evolution of the mortgage-backed security market in the United States. He served as the Chief Executive Officer at BlackRock International Limited. Mr. Fink served as a Member of the Executive Board at NYSE Euronext, Inc. (AKA NYSE Euronext Holdings, LLC). He serves as the Chairman of Nomura BlackRock Asset Management Co., Ltd. Mr. Fink served as Vice-Chairman of New York University and serves as its Trustee. column3: Chief Executive Officer, President, Director and Member of Finance Committee,
column5: University of Pennsylvania - The Wharton School
column10: Mr. William C. Cobb, Bill serves as the Chief Executive Officer and President of H&R Block Bank. Mr. Cobb has been the Chief Executive Officer and the President of H&R Block Inc. since May 16, 2011. He served as the President of eBay Marketplaces of North America at eBay Inc. since December 2006. He served as the President of the flagship U.S. Marketplaces division. He served as President of eBay North America of eBay Inc. from December 2004 to December 2006 and as also ... served as its Senior Vice President of Global Marketing from November 2000 to September 2002. He served as Senior Vice President of eBay International, a subsidiary of eBay Inc. from September 2002 to December 2004 and also served as its General Manager since September 2002 and Senior Vice President of Global Marketing, where he was responsible for strategic planning, development, and operations for its businesses and investments around the world. He joined eBay in November 2000 and served there until 2008. Prior to eBay, Mr. Cobb served at PepsiCo. as Vice President of New Business and was responsible for new products, joint ventures and acquisitions for the soft drink division. He served various marketing and executive positions at Pepsico/Tricon for thirteen years. He served a number of key positions at Frito Lay and Pepsi-Cola divisions. From February 2000 to June 2000, he served as General Manager of Consumer Sales of Netpliance, Inc. He served as Senior Vice President of International Marketing of Tricon Global Restaurants, Inc. (now YUM! Brands, Inc.), from July 1997 to February 2000. He served as Senior Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer of Pizza Hut, Inc., a division of Tricon Global Restaurants, Inc. from August 1995 to July 1997. He served as Senior Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer for Tricon Restaurants International, a PepsiCo spin-off, where he Vice President for Colas of Pepsi-Cola Co., a division of PepsiCo., Inc. from May 1994 to August 1995. He served as an International Chief Marketing Officer of Tricon. Mr. Cobb served as Vice President of Pepsi Brands. He has been a Director at H&R Block, Inc. since August 2010. He serves as a Director of the non-profit Bay Harbor Foundation. He serves on the Advisory Board of the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University. He served as a Director of Och-Ziff Capital Management Group LLC from September 2008 to June 23, 2011; Pacific Sunwear of California Inc. from August 2008 to June 1, 2011 and Orbitz Worldwide Inc. from July 2008 to March 25, 2011. He served as a Member of the Board of Industry Leaders of Consumer Electronics Association. His accomplishments include the launch of All Sport Body Quencher, Aquafina Water, and the Pepsi/Starbucks Coffee partnership for ready-to-drink coffee products. Mr. Cobb holds a Bachelors of Science in Economics from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania and a Masters of Business Administration from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University. served as its Senior Vice President of Global Marketing from November 2000 to September 2002. column3: Executive Chairman, Chief Executive Officer, Chairman of Special Programs Committee and Member of Stock Plan Committee,
column10: Mr. W. James McNerney, also known as Jim, Jr. has been the Chief Executive Officer and Executive Chairman at The Boeing Company at Boeing Commercial Airplanes, Inc. since July 1, 2005. Mr. McNerney served as President at The Boeing Company. Before taking the helm at Boeing on July 1, 2005, he served as the Chief Executive Officer of 3M Company from January 1, 2001 to June 2005, and served as its Chairman from 2001 to June 2005. He served as the Chief Executive Officer ... and Chairman of 3M Cardiovascular Devices, Inc. He joined 3M in 2000 after 19 years at the General Electric Company. He joined General Electric in 1982. He served in management positions at General Electric Company, including the Chief Executive Officer and the President of GE Aircraft Engines from 1997 to 2000. At General Electric, he served as the Chief Executive Officer and the President of GE Lighting, Cleveland, OH from 1995 to 1997; President of GE Asia-Pacific, Hong Kong from 1993 to 1995, the Chief Executive Officer and the President of GE Electrical Distribution & Control, Plainville, CT from 1991 to 1992, Executive Vice President of GE Financial Services and GE Capital, Stamford, CT from 1989 to 1991, the President of GE Information Services of Rockville, Managing Director from 1988 to 1989 and as General Manager of GE Mobile Communications from 1982 to 1988. He first worked at Procter & Gamble in brand management and as a Senior Manager of McKinsey & Co., Inc. He serves as Chairman of Boeing Commercial Airplanes, Inc. He served as the Chairman of The Business Roundtable since September 1, 2011. He served as the Chairman of US-China Business Council, Inc. and The Business Council. He serves as a Director of The Business Roundtable. He has been an Executive Director of Boeing Co. since 2001. He has been a Presiding Director of Procter & Gamble Co. since August 14, 2007 and has been its Director since May 1, 2003. He serves as a Director of Northwestern Memorial Healthcare, and the Greater Twin Cities United Way. He serves as a Trustee of Center for Strategic and International Studies, Inc. He serves as Trustee of Field Museum Of Natural History and Northwestern University. He serves as a Director of US-China Business Council, Inc. He has been a Director of International Business Machines Corporation (IBM) since 2009. He serves as a Member of the Advisory Board of Kellogg Graduate School of Management and the World Business Council for Sustainable Development. He served as a Director of 3M Cardiovascular Devices, Inc. and The Business Council. He served as a Director of 3M Co. from January 1, 2001 to June 2005. He is a Member of various business and educational organizations. By appointment of U.S. President Barack Obama, he chairs the President's Export Council, which operates as an advisory committee on international trade. He is a Member of the CEO Fiscal Leadership Council, a non-partisan effort to mobilize support for a comprehensive U.S. federal debt-reduction agreement. He received 2012 inaugural Turning Point Award from the U.S. Army War College Foundation for leadership that resulted in a strategic turning point for Boeing; 2012 Semper Fidelis Award from the Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation for service to the United States that exemplifies the Marine Corps motto to remain ﾊﾗﾓAlways Faithfulﾊﾗﾓ; 2011 John W. Dixon Award from the Association of the U.S. Army for outstanding contributions to national defense; and 2008 National Management Association's Executive of the Year. Mr. McNerney is a fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences and an honorary fellow of the Royal Aeronautical Society. He received honorary Doctor of Science degree from Cranfield University for his contributions to the international aerospace industry in 2009. Mr. McNerney earned a BA Degree from Yale University in 1971 and an MBA from Harvard University in 1975. and Chairman of 3M Cardiovascular Devices, Inc. He joined 3M in 2000 after 19 years at the General Electric Company. He joined General Electric in 1982. He served in management positions at General Electric Company, including the Chief Executive Officer and the President of GE Aircraft Engines from 1997 to 2000. At General Electric, he served as the Chief Executive Officer and the President of GE Lighting, Cleveland, OH from 1995 to 1997; President of GE Asia-Pacific, Hong Kong from 1993 to 1995, the Chief Executive Officer and the President of GE Electrical Distribution & Control, Plainville, CT from 1991 to 1992, Executive Vice President of GE Financial Services and GE Capital, Stamford, CT from 1989 to 1991, the President of GE Information Services of Rockville, Managing Director from 1988 to 1989 and as General Manager of GE Mobile Communications from 1982 to 1988. He first worked at Procter & Gamble in brand management and as a Senior Manager of McKinsey & Co., Inc. He serves as Chairman of Boeing Commercial Airplanes, Inc. He served as the Chairman of The Business Roundtable since September 1, 2011. He served as the Chairman of US-China Business Council, Inc. and The Business Council. He serves as a Director of The Business Roundtable. He has been an Executive Director of Boeing Co. since 2001. He has been a Presiding Director of Procter & Gamble Co. since August 14, 2007 and has been its Director since May 1, 2003. He serves as a Director of Northwestern Memorial Healthcare, and the Greater Twin Cities United Way. He serves as a Trustee of Center for Strategic and International Studies, Inc. He serves as Trustee of Field Museum Of Natural History and Northwestern University. He serves as a Director of US-China Business Council, Inc. He has been a Director of International Business Machines Corporation (IBM) since 2009. He serves as a Member of the Advisory Board of Kellogg Graduate School of Management and the World Business Council for Sustainable Development. He served as a Director of 3M Cardiovascular Devices, Inc. and The Business Council. He served as a Director of 3M Co. from January 1, 2001 to June 2005. He is a Member of various business and educational organizations. By appointment of U.S. President Barack Obama, he chairs the President's Export Council, which operates as an advisory committee on international trade. He is a Member of the CEO Fiscal Leadership Council, a non-partisan effort to mobilize support for a comprehensive U.S. federal debt-reduction agreement. He received 2012 inaugural Turning Point Award from the U.S. Army War College Foundation for leadership that resulted in a strategic turning point for Boeing; 2012 Semper Fidelis Award from the Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation for service to the United States that exemplifies the Marine Corps motto to remain ﾊﾗﾓAlways Faithfulﾊﾗﾓ; 2011 John W. Dixon Award from the Association of the U.S. Army for outstanding contributions to national defense; and 2008 National Management Association's Executive of the Year. Mr. McNerney is a fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences and an honorary fellow of the Royal Aeronautical Society. He received honorary Doctor of Science degree from Cranfield University for his contributions to the international aerospace industry in 2009. Mr. McNerney earned a BA Degree from Yale University in 1971 and an MBA from Harvard University in 1975.

column3: Chief Executive Officer, President and Director,
column10: Mr. Michael F. Mahoney, also known as Mike has been the Chief Executive Officer of Boston Scientific Corporation since November 1, 2012 and as its President since October 17, 2011. At Boston Scientific Corporation, Mr. Mahoney is responsible for Boston Scientific's Cardiac Rhythm Management (CRM) and Endoscopy (GI and Pulmonary) businesses, as well as certain corporate functions. He joined Boston Scientific in October 2011, having established a track record of more than ... 22 years of healthcare experience in building market leading global businesses in medical devices, capital equipment, and healthcare IT service businesses at best-in-class companies. Prior to joining Boston Scientific, he served as Worldwide Chairman of Medical Device and Diagnostics Group (MD&D) at Johnson & Johnson since January 3, 2011. He served as a Group Chairman, DePuy Franchise of Johnson & Johnson until January 3, 2011. In this role, he successfully drove a growth strategy via product innovation, multiple acquisitions, and International expansion, particularly in China and India. Prior to joining Johnson & Johnson, Mr. Mahoney served as the President and Chief Executive Officer of Global Healthcare Exchange (GHX). He built Global Healthcare Exchange through organic development and strategic acquisitions, successfully integrating seven acquisitions and expanding the business into Europe and Canada. He built his early career at General Electric Medical Systems, where he spent 12 years, in a variety of advancing leadership roles for domestic and global businesses in CT, MRI, X-ray, Healthcare IT, and Nuclear Medicine, culminating in the role of General Manager of the Healthcare Information Technology business. He serves as a Director of Boston Scientific Corporation. Mr. Mahoney earned a B.B.A. in Finance from the University of Iowa and a M.B.A. from Wake Forest University. 22 years of healthcare experience in building market leading global businesses in medical devices, capital equipment, and healthcare IT service businesses at best-in-class companies. He has been a Director of National Cable Satellite Corporation since 2012, Cablevision Systems Corporation since 1991; CSC Holdings Inc., since 1991 and AMC Networks Inc. since March 9, 2011. He serves as a Director of Madison Square Garden of Cablevision Systems Corp. He serves as a Director of the Lustgarten Foundation for Pancreatic Cancer Research, an organization he helped found in 1998. Mr. Dolan created and managed WKNR-AM, leveland's first all-sports talk radio station. He served as a Member of the board of Live Nation Entertainment, Inc. since June 30, 2011 until February 22, 2013. He is a member of television station WNET's board of trustees and sits on the board and executive committee of the National Cable Television Association (NCTA). An ardent fan of the three MSG teams, he is a frequent presence at their home games. Among his most significant accomplishments, he spearheaded a multi-million dollar effort to restore Radio City Music Hall to its original splendor for the enjoyment of all New Yorkers. Mr. Dolan is honorary chair of Cable Positive's board of directors and serves as chairman of the Capital Campaign Committee at Friends Academy.

column3: Chief Executive Officer, President and Director,
column10: Ms. Denise M. Morrison has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Campbell Soup Company since August 1, 2011. Ms. Morrison served as the Chief Operating Officer and Executive Vice President of Campbell Soup Co. from October 1, 2010 to August 1, 2011. She served as the President of North America Soup Sauces & Beverages of Campbell Soup Co. from October 2007 to 2010 and served as its Chief Operating Officer and Senior Vice President since April 2003. She served ... as the President of U.S. Soup, Sauces and Beverages of Campbell Soup Co. from June 1, 2005 to 2007. She served as the President of Global Sales and Chief Customer Officer at Campbell Soup Company from joining it on April 28, 2003 to June 2005. She spent more than 30 years in the food business. She has a distinguished track record of building strong businesses and growing iconic brands. She served as an Executive Vice President and General Manager of Snacks Division at Mondelez International, Inc. (alternate name: Kraft Foods Inc.), from October 2001 to March 2003, where she was responsible for such leading brands as Planters nuts, Lifesavers and Altoids. Before October 2001, Ms. Morrison served as an Executive Vice President and General Manager of Confections Division of Kraft Foods, Inc., from January 2001 to September 2001 and was responsible for leading brands including Planters nuts, Life Savers candies, and Altoids mints. She served as Senior Vice President of Nabisco Inc. from March 1998 to December 2000. Ms. Morrison held senior sales and marketing positions at Nestle, USA from 1984 to 1995. She served as a Manager of Business and Project Development at Pepsi-Cola Bottling Company and began her career in the sales organization at The Procter & Gamble Company. She has been a Director of Campbell Soup Co. since October 1, 2010 and MetLife, Inc., since February 21, 2014. Ms. Morrison serves as a Board Member of Enactus (formerly Students in Free Enterprise). She served as Director of FTI Consulting, Inc. She served as Member of the Advisory Board for Catalyst Inc. She served as a Director of Ballard Power Systems Inc., since 2002. Ms. Morrison served as a Non-Management Director of The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company since February 23, 2005. She is a founding member of the Healthy Weight Commitment Foundation. She serves on the board of the Grocery Manufacturers Association, where she chairs its Health and Wellness Committee, and on the board of the Consumer Goods Forum. She serves as the President of the New Jersey Women's Forum. She is a member of the GMA Industry Affairs Council. She was named to President Barack Obama���s Export Council in 2012. She is regularly named among the Fortune and Forbes Most Powerful Women. She has been one of Fortune magazine's Most Powerful Women in Business" since 1999. In 2006

column10: Mr. Arnold W. Donald has been the Chief Executive Officer and President at Carnival Corporation & Plc since July 3, 2013. Mr. Donald has been the Chief Executive Officer Carnival Plc and Carnival Corporation since July 3, 2013. He serves as an Operating Partner and Director of Atlas Holdings LLC and focuses on industrial services, trading, and distribution. He serves as an Executive Advisor Partner of Wind Point Partners. He has industry expertise in the agriculture, ... biochemical, chemicals, and service sectors for over 30 years. Mr. Donald served as a Senior Executive at Monsanto Company in St. Louis, MO and joined in 1977, where he served various positions over 23 years, including as the President at Monsanto's Nutrition and Consumer sectors and Senior Vice President of the parent company. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of TransCanada Corp. He served as Senior Vice President of Monsanto Co. from January 1998 to March, 2000. He served as the President at the Agricultural Products Division, where Mr. Donald was responsible for three years of tremendous growth and marked by the successful introduction and commercialization of Monsanto's first crop protection products resulting from modern plant biotechnology. From March, 2000 to March, 2003, he served as the Chief Executive Officer at Merisant Company. From March 2000 to June 2003, he served as Chief Executive Officer at Tabletop Holdings. He serves as the Chairman of Merisant US Inc. Mr. Donald has been a Director of Russell Brands, LLC since June 2004. He serves as a Member of the National Science Teachers Association Advisory Board. He serves as a Director of DHR International, Inc. and Global Velocity Inc. He has been a Director at Carnival plc since April 17, 2003. Since 1999, he has been a Director at Crown Holdings Inc since 1999 and Carnival Corporation & Plc since January 2001. Mr. Donald serves as a Member of the Board of Managers at Bridgewell Resources LLC. He serves as a Director of BJC Health System, Inc. and Crown Cork & Seal Company, Inc. He served as a Director of Bank of Montreal and of Harris Financial Corporation, Efficas, Inc.; The Scotts Miracle-gro Co. from 2000 to January 22, 2009; Belden Inc. since August 2000; and Laclede Gas Company since 2003. He served as the Chairman of the Board of Merisant Company from March 2000 to November 2005 and Chairman of Merisant Worldwide Inc., since April, 2000 and has been its Director since April, 2000. He has been an Independent Director at Bank of America Corporation since January 23, 2013. Mr. Donald also serves on the Boards of Carleton College; Washington University; United Way of Greater St. Louis; St. Louis Art Museum; Missouri Botanical Garden; St. Louis Science Center; Opera Theatre of St. Louis; Boy Scouts of America Greater St. Louis Area Council; St. Louis Regional Commerce and Growth Association; Barnes-Jewish Hospital; Grocery Manufacturers of America and St. Louis Sports Commission. He served as a Director of Oil-Dri Corp. of America from 1997 to January 23, 2013; Merisant Company since April 2000; and BMO Financial Corp. since February 2009. He served as Director of The Laclede Group, Inc. He served as the Chairman at Coca-Cola Enterprises Inc. from April 2008 to October 2010. Mr. Brock served as the Chairman of Coca-Cola Refreshments USA, Inc. since April 22, 2008. He served as the Chairman of Dr. Pepper/Seven-Up Bottling Group from March 2000 to January 2003. He served as Co-Chairman of the Board of Companhia de Bebidas Das Americas since 2005. He has been a Director of Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. since February 05, 2014. He served as a Director of Coca-Cola Refreshments USA, Inc. since April 25, 2006. He was Director of Dow Jones & Company, Inc. since April 18, 2007. He was Director of InBev. He served as a Director of Dr. Pepper/Seven Up, Inc. since March 2, 1995. He served as a Director at Campbell Soup Co. from November 18, 2004 to May 15, 2006. He served as Member of the Board of Cadbury Schweppes from 1996 to 2000. He served as a Member of the Supervisory Board of Reed Elsevier NV, since April 1999. Mr. Brock served as a Non-executive Director of Reed Elsevier Group PLC from April 1999 to April 2005 and Reed Elsevier PLC since April 1999, both subsidiaries of Reed Elsevier NV. He served as a Director of Cadbury Limited (also known as Cadbury plc, Cadbury Schweppes PLC) from 1986 to December 19, 2002. He served as Director of The American Beverage Association. He is a Director of the Georgia Institute of Technology President's Advisory Board. The respect he commanded among his peers led the US beverage industry to name him ﾊﾗﾓExecutive of the Yearﾊﾗﾓ in 2000. Mr. Brock has a Masters Degree in Chemical Engineering from the Georgia Institute of Technology.

column10: Mr. Ryan M. Lance has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of ConocoPhillips since May 2012. Mr. Lance has 28 years of oil and natural gas industry experience in senior management and technical positions with ConocoPhillips, predecessor Phillips Petroleum and various divisions of ARCO Alaska, Inc. He served as Senior Vice President of Exploration & Production - International of ConocoPhillips and ConocoPhillips (U.K.) Limited since May 2009. Mr. Lance served ... as President of Exploration & Production, Asia Africa, Middle East and Russia/Caspian of ConocoPhillips and also served as its Senior Vice President of Technology since 2007. He served as Senior Vice President of Technology and Major Projects at Conocophillips from April 1, 2006 to February 1, 2007 and President of Asia Pacific Exploration and Production from May 8, 2003 to June 2005. He served as President Exploration & Production, Europe Asia Africa and the Middle East of ConocoPhillips. He served as President of downstream strategy, integration and specialty functions at ConocoPhillips since 2005 and as Vice President of Lower 48 since 2002. He served as President of Strategy Integration and Specialty Businesses - Refining Marketing Supply & Transportation of ConocoPhillips from June 2005 to April 1, 2006. Mr. Lance began his career with ARCO Alaska in 1984. He held various management, engineering and operations positions internationally as well as in Alaska and the U.S. Lower 48 before transferring in 1989 to ARCO's Bakersfield, Calif. operations. In 1992, he transferred to Midland, Texas, where he supervised ARCO's coalbed methane operations in the San Juan Basin. He returned to Alaska in 1994 as Exploration Engineering Manager. In 1996, he transferred to Vastar Resources in Houston as Planning Manager and served in that position until 1998. He served as Vice President of the Western North Slope for ARCO Alaska, Inc. since 1998. Mr. Lance returned to Houston in 2001 as the General Manager of Lower 48 and Canadian operations for Phillips Petroleum. He spent 17 years with ARCO. He has been a Director of ConocoPhillips since May 9, 2012. He serves as a Director for Spindletop International as well as on the Montana Tech Foundation���s board. He serves on the University of Houston���s Energy Advisory Board. He serves on the Boards of both the American Petroleum Institute and the Independent Petroleum Association of America. He is an Advisory board Member of Montana Tech and a Member of the Society of Petroleum Engineers. He is a Petroleum Engineer. Mr. Lance earned a Bachelor of Science in Petroleum Engineering from Montana Tech in Butte in 1984. as President of Exploration & Production, Asia Africa, Middle East and Russia/Caspian of ConocoPhillips and also served as its Senior Vice President of Technology since 2007. column10: Mr. Samuel R. Allen, also known as Sam, has been the Chairman of Deere & Company since February 24, 2010 and as its Chief Executive Officer since August 1, 2009. Mr. Allen serves as the Chairman of the Board and Principal Executive Officer of John Deere Capital Corp. He served as the President of John Deere Power Systems from March 2005 to June 2009. He served as President of Deere & Co. since June 1, 2009. He served as the President for Worldwide Construction & Forestry ... Division of Deere & Co. since February 24, 2005. He served as President of Global Financial Services and President of Corporate Human Resources of Deere & Co. from November 2003 to 2005. and also served as its Senior Vice President since 2001. At Deere & Co. Mr. Allen was responsible for recruiting, and development and retention practices, aimed at creating a knowledgeable and skilled workforce. He was also responsible for compensation planning and union negotiations. He also provides leadership to John Deere Power Systems and Deere & Company's equipment financing subsidiary. In December 2003, he assumed additional responsibility for NavCom Technology, Inc. and Phoenix International Corporation, operating units in Deere & Company's Special Technologies Group. He joined Deere & Company in 1975 and served as its Industrial Engineer. He has held management positions in the areas of production control, manufacturing, supply management, and operations at John Deere Horicon Works, Des Moines Works, Dubuque Works, Davenport Works, and Waterloo Engine Works. Mr. Allen was instrumental in the planning and implementation of John Deere's engine manufacturing facility in Torreon, Mexico. column3: Chairman, Chief Executive Officer, President, Member of Mergers & Acquisitions Committee and Member of Finance Committee,
column10: Mr. Joseph M. Tucci, known as Joe, has been the Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and President of EMC Corporation since January 2006, January 2001 and February 6, 2014 respectively. Mr. Tucci serves as a Member of Executive Council of TechNet. He served as the Chief Operating Officer of EMC Corporation from January 2000 to January 2001 and served as its President from January 2000 to July 2012. Mr. Tucci has led EMC through a period of dramatic revitalization, continued ... market share gains, and sustained double-digit growth. He has transformed EMC Corporation's business model from what was a near exclusive focus on high-end storage platforms to the industry's most comprehensive portfolio of best-of-breed platforms, software, services, and solutions that enable organizations to implement information lifecycle management, aligning their information technology infrastructure with their business based on the changing value of their information. In 2011, Mr. Tucci oversaw the most aggressive new product introduction cycle in the company's history. Since 2003, he has spearheaded the investment of more than $14 billion in strategic acquisitions to fill out EMC's product portfolio, enter new market segments, and expand the company's addressable market opportunity. He has led EMC into multi-platform open software, expanded the company's marketplace beyond large enterprises to commercial and small-medium businesses, broadened the company's industry alliances, and established new selling, partnership and distribution channels. Over the same period, Mr. Tucci has strengthened EMC's management team with the integration of executives from other major technology companies. He has championed EMC's use of Six Sigma to improve its business processes and has engaged employees in the Total Customer Experience, EMC's commitment to consistently exceed customers' expectations for quality, service, innovation, and interaction. Acknowledging EMC's rejuvenation under Mr. Tucci���s leadership, Barron���s named him one of the world���s Best Chief Executive Officer s in 2011. He served at Telecom Italia S.p.A. He served as a Deputy Chief Executive Officer of Getronics NV from June 1999 to December 1999. Mr. Tucci served as the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer at Wang Global Inc. from December 1993 to June 1999 and served as the President since January 1993, directing the financial and operational rebirth of it for six years. He joined Wang Global in 1990 as an Executive Vice President of Operations. At Wang, he guided it through a rapid and successful emergence from Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection and transformed it from a midrange computer manufacturer into a worldwide leader in networked technology services and solutions. Under his leadership, Wang Global acquired and integrated 10 companies from 1995 to 1999, and its market capitalization more than tripled. Prior to joining the firm, he served as the President of U.S.A Information Systems at Unisys Corporation, a position he assumed after the 1986 merger of Sperry and Burroughs that created Unisys. Mr. Tucci started his career as a Systems Programmer at RCA Corporation. He is a Member of Board of Overseers of Columbia Business School. Mr. Tucci has been the Chairman of the Board and a Director of VMware, Inc. (VMware Corporation) since April 2007. He serves as a Member of Advisory Board of Salesnet Inc. He serves as a Member of Advisory Board at New Mountain Capital, LLC. He has been a Director of Paychex Inc., since January 2000 and EMC Corporation since January 2001. Mr. Tucci serves as a Member of the United States President's Council of Advisors on Science and Technology (PCAST). He serves as a Member of the Board of Advisors of the Carroll School of Management at Boston College and the School of Economics and Management at Tsinghua University, Beijing. Mr. Tucci also serves as a Trustee\Member of the Board of Overseers of Northeastern University and Boston Symphony Orchestra. He has been a Member of Strategic Advisory Board of Bridge Growth Partners, LLC since June 24, 2013. He served as a Director of International Integration since May 1995 He served as a Director of. He served as a Director of Data Domain, Inc. since July 2009. Mr. Tucci served as a Director of Wang Laboratories Inc. since October 1993. He served as a Member of Supervisory Board of Getronics NV until April 2002. He is one of 150 Chief Executive Officer Members of The Business Roundtable and served as the Chairman of the Task Force on Education and the Workforce. Mr. Tucci holds an M.B.A. in Finance from Columbia University in 1984. column3: Chief Executive Officer, President, Executive Director and Member of Finance Committee,
column10: Mr. Alan R. Mulally has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Ford Motor Co. since September 1, 2006. Prior to joining Ford in September 2006, Mr. Mulally served as Executive Vice President of The Boeing Company since August 2002. He served as President and Chief Executive Officer of Boeing Commercial Airplanes, Inc. from September 1998 to September 5, 2006 and from August 2002 to September 5, 2006, respectively. In that role, he was responsible for all of ... Boeing's commercial airplane programs and related services. Mr. Mulally joined Boeing in 1969 and served as an Engineer or Program Manager on its 727, 737, 747, 757 and 767 airplanes; Vice President of Engineering and General Manager of The 777 Program. He served as Chief Executive Officer of Boeing Commercial Airplanes Group since March 2001 and served as its Executive Vice President. Mr. Mulally served as Senior Vice President of Airplane Development and Definition at Boeing Commercial Airplane Group since 1994. He served as a Member of the Executive Council at The Boeing Company and served as its Senior Executive in the Pacific Northwest. Mr. Mulally served as President of Boeing Information, Space & Defense Systems from August 1997 to August 1998. He served as President of Boeing Defense & Space Group since January 1997. Mr. Mulally served as Senior Vice President of The Boeing Company since February 1997, he was responsible for Boeing's defense, space and government business. He has been an Executive Director of Ford Motor Co. since September 2006. Mr. Mulally served as a Director of Boeing Capital Corp. He serves as Co-Chairman of the Washington Competitiveness Council, and sits on the Advisory Boards of NASA, the University of Washington, the University of Kansas, Massachusetts Institute of Technology and the U.S. Air Force Scientific Advisory Board. Mr. Mulally serves as President of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics's Foundation. He served as President of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA). Mr. Mulally also served as Chairman of the Board of Governors of the Aerospace Industries Association. Throughout his career, He has been recognized for his contributions and industry leadership, including being named one of The Best Leaders of 2005" by BusinessWeek magazine for streamlining Boeing's production system and transforming its commercial airplanes product line. He honored in 2002 for distinguished service by the University of Kansas. Mr. Mulally was named an honorary fellow of England's Royal Aeronautical Society in 1999. He selected in 1996 as a Laureate

column10: Mr. Brenton L. Saunders, also known as Brent, J.D., has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Forest Laboratories Inc. since October 1, 2013. Mr. Saunders served as an Advisor of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International, Inc. since August 2013. He served as Senior Vice President of Compliance, Legal and Regulatory at HomeCare America. Mr. Saunders served as the Chief Executive Officer of Bausch & Lomb Incorporated and Bausch & Lomb Holdings Incorporated since ... March 15, 2010. Mr. Saunders served as a Special Adviser of General Atlantic LLC. From 2010 to February 2013, he served as President of Bausch & Lomb Holdings Incorporated. He served as a Senior Executive of Schering-Plough from 2003 to 2010 and served as its President of Global Consumer Health Care. He served as Head of Integration for both Schering-Plough's merger with Merck & Co. He served as President of Consumer Health Care and Senior Vice President of Schering-Plough Corp. since February 2007. Mr. Saunders was responsible for leading the U.S. and Canadian Consumer Health Care business and works collaboratively with the Global Pharmaceutical Business unit. He served as Senior Vice President, Global Compliance and Business Practices of Schering-Plough Corp. from November 1, 2003 to February 20, 2007. He served as a Member of Executive Management Team (EMT) and the Operations Management Team (OMT) of Schering-Plough Corp. His responsibilities included the development of Global Standards, Training and Enforcement Programs for Compliance in all areas of Schering Plough Corp., including manufacturing, R&D programs, clinical trials and sales and marketing. He was also responsible for the implementation of privacy policies for customers, patients, employees and other stakeholders. He has extensive experience negotiating and implementing corporate integrity agreements with state and federal agencies. He has significant healthcare industry expertise and led various business transformations and integrations. He has extensive knowledge of compliance, risk assessment, strategy and business development and extensive experience as an officer and director of public companies in the healthcare and pharmaceuticals industry. Mr. Saunders joined Schering-Plough from PricewaterhouseCoopers where he led its compliance business advisory services group. He was a Partner and Head of the Compliance Business Advisory Group at PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP from 2000 to 2003. He served as Chief Compliance Officer for Coventry Health Care and for Thomas Jefferson University and Health System. He was the co-founder and President of the Health Care Compliance Association. He serevd as Senior Vice President of Compliance, Legal, and Regulatory at Home Care Corp. of America. He served as Chief Risk Officer of Coventry Health Care from 1998 to 1999. He co-founded Health Care Compliance Association in 1995. He served as Chairman of the New York chapter of the American Heart Association. He also serves on the transition team for New Jersey Governor-Elect Chris Christie. In 1997, Mr. Saunders was named Compliance Officer of the Year at Health Care Compliance Association. Mr. Saunders has been a Director of Forest Laboratories Inc. since August 2011. He serves on the Boards of ElectroCore, LLC and the Overlook Hospital Foundation. He has been a Member of Upstate New York Regional Advisory Board at The Federal Reserve Bank of New York since June 9, 2010. He served as Director of Bausch & Lomb Holdings Incorporated and Bausch & Lomb Incorporated since March 15, 2010. He is a noted speaker on compliance and risk management issues in the health care industry, and also taught health law at Widener School of Law as an adjunct faculty Member. Mr. Saunders has a JD from the Temple University School of Law, an MBA from the Temple University School of Business and Management, and graduated with a BA in Economics from the University of Pittsburgh. column10: Mr. J. Paul Raines has been the Chief Executive Officer of GameStop Corp. (GameStop UK Ltd) since June 2010. Mr. Raines is responsible for all store operations merchandising, marketing, supply chain, and real estate activities for GameStop in the United States and Canada. He has more than 22 years of senior level experience in corporate management. He has a wealth of retail operations expertise and has an impressive track-record with executing strategies to support the ... customer experience and drive positive results. He served as Chief Operating Officer of GameStop Corp., from September 2008 to May 2010. Mr. Raines served as Treasurer of The Homer Fund, Inc. He served as Executive Vice President of U.S Stores at The Home Depot, Inc. from May 1, 2007 to August 2008, Southern Division President from February 2005 to May 1, 2007 and also served as its Divisional President since December 2004. He was responsible for 759 stores in 18 southern states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico and St. Thomas. He served as Regional Vice President of Florida of The Home Depot from April 2003 to January 2005. From December 2002 to March 2003, he served as Vice President of Store Operations at The Home Depot and from April 2000 to November 2002 and served as its Director of Labor Management from January 2000 to January 2002 as well as its Director of Operations Support for Chile and Argentina. He served at The Home Depot for six years. He served as Director of Global Sourcing for LL Bean for five years, and also served as a Principal of Kurt Salmon Associates for 10 years. Mr. Raines has been a Director of Advance Auto Parts Inc. since February 1, 2010 and GameStop Corp. since 2012. He serves as Director of The Home Depot Foundation., The Latin American Association (LAA) of Atlanta, and the Hispanic Association of Corporate Responsibility (HACR) Alumni. column10: Dr. Lawrence Page, also known as Larry co-founded Google Inc. in 1998 and has been its Chief Executive Officer since April 4, 2011. Dr. Page previously served as Chief Executive Officer of Google Inc. from September 1998 to July 2001 and served as its Chief Financial Officer from September 1998 to July 2002. He served as President of Products at Google Inc. from July 2001 to April 2011 and also served as its Assistant Secretary. He worked at Chips & Technologies, Inc. ... He served as President of the University's Eta Kappa Nu Honor Society and built a programmable plotter and inkjet printer out of Legoﾁﾍ. Dr. Page has been a Director of Google Inc. since its inception in September 1998. He serves as a Trustee of X PRIZE (also known as X PRIZE Foundation). He is a member of the National Advisory Committee (NAC) for the University of Michigan College of Engineering. He is a speaker at such forums as the Technology, Entertainment and Design Conference, The Wall Street Journal Technology Summit, the World Economic Forum and the Commonwealth Club. He served at National Academy of Engineering since 2004. He was named a World Economic Forum Global Leader for Tomorrow in 2002 as well as a ﾊﾗﾓYoung Innovator Who Will Create the Futureﾊﾗﾓ by MIT's Technology Review magazine. He has been recognized as Research and Development Magazine's Innovator of the Year. Dr. Page was honored with the Marconi Prize in 2004. Dr. Page was granted an honorary MBA by Instituto De Empresa and was the first recipient of the University of Michigan Alumni Society Recent Engineering Graduate Award. He holds a Masters degree in Computer Science from Stanford University and a Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Engineering from the University of Michigan. He served as President of the University's Eta Kappa Nu Honor Society and built a programmable plotter and inkjet printer out of Legoﾁﾍ. Dr. Page has been a Director of Google Inc. since its inception in September 1998. He serves as a Trustee of X PRIZE (also known as X PRIZE Foundation). He is a member of the National Advisory Committee (NAC) for the University of Michigan College of Engineering. He is a speaker at such forums as the Technology, Entertainment and Design Conference, The Wall Street Journal Technology Summit, the World Economic Forum and the Commonwealth Club. He served at National Academy of Engineering since 2004. He was named a World Economic Forum Global Leader for Tomorrow in 2002 as well as a ﾊﾗﾓYoung Innovator Who Will Create the Futureﾊﾗﾓ by MIT's Technology Review magazine. He has been recognized as Research and Development Magazine's Innovator of the Year. Dr. Page was honored with the Marconi Prize in 2004. Dr. Page was granted an honorary MBA by Instituto De Empresa and was the first recipient of the University of Michigan Alumni Society Recent Engineering Graduate Award. Mr. Krzanich served as the Chief Operating Officer of Intel Corporation since January 20, 2012 until May 16, 2013, and its Executive Vice President from November 2012 to May 16, 2013. Mr. Krzanich served as Senior Vice President of Intel Corporation from January 2010 to November 2012 and its General Manager of Manufacturing & Supply Chain until January 20, 2012 and also ... served as its Head of Worldwide Manufacturing. He was responsible for all aspects of Intel's factories and operations worldwide. He served as Vice President of Intel Corp. from December 2005 to January 2010. Mr. Krzanich served as General Manager of Manufacturing and Supply Chain of Intel Corp. Mr. Krzanich was responsible for all aspects of Intel's assembly and test operations worldwide. Mr. Krzanich served as General Manager of Assembly/Test of Intel Corp. He joined Intel in 1982. Since 2001, Mr. Krzanich has been responsible for the implementation of the 0.13-micron logic process technology across Intel's global factory network. From 1997 to 2001, Mr. Krzanich served as the Fab 17 plant manager, where he oversaw integrating Digital Equipment Corporation's semiconductor manufacturing operations into Intel's manufacturing network. The assignment included building updated facilities as well as initiating and ramping 0.18-micron and 0.13-micron process technologies. From 1996 to 1997, Mr. Krzanich was the Fab 6 plant manager in Arizona. From 1994 to 1996, he was a manufacturing manager for Fab 12 in Arizona. Previously, he was a process engineer at various Intel locations. He serves as a Director of MiaSole, Inc. Mr. Krzanich was presented an Intel Achievement Award in 1999. He holds one patent for semiconductor processing. Mr. Krzanich studied bachelor's degree in Chemistry from San Jose State University in 1982. served as its Head of Worldwide Manufacturing. column10: Mr. James J. Ethridge, Jr. also known as Jay, serves as the Chief Executive Officer of The Interpublic Group of Companies, Inc. Mr. Ethridge serves as Chief Executive Officer and President of Implantable Provider Group, Inc. Mr. Ethridge was an integral part of the success that created one of the three leading manufacturers in the medical device industry, which was ultimately purchased by Boston Scientific in 2006 for more than $24 billion. With a career in the medical ... industry, first pharmaceutical and then medical devices, Mr. Ethridge has a proven track record as a results-oriented senior level operating executive with a keen understanding of the implantable medical device industry. It is Mr. Ethridge's business development, sales and marketing experience over a 20 year career in this industry that enhances IPG's capabilities to deliver the results that are promised to clients. Mr. Ethridge joined IPG in May 2006 and has successfully lead IPG's transition from a start-up, founder led organization to a professionally managed and capitalized organization well positioned for future growth. Mr. Ethridge serves as Director of Implantable Provider Group, Inc. Mr. Ethridge received his undergraduate degree from The Citadel and his MBA from the University of Georgia. industry, first pharmaceutical and then medical devices, Mr. Ethridge has a proven track record as a results-oriented senior level operating executive with a keen understanding of the implantable medical device industry. column3: Chairman, Chief Executive Officer, President and Chairman of Executive Committee,
column10: Mrs. Virginia M. Rometty, known as Ginni, has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of International Business Machines Corporation since January 1, 2012. She is the Chairman of IBM, Chief Executive Officer of IBM and President of IBM at IBM Business Consulting Services, Inc. She is the Chairman of IBM Corporation, Chief Executive Officer of IBM Corporation and President of IBM Corporation at IBM Global Services (U.S.). Mrs. Rometty served as Managing Partner ... of IBM Business Consulting Services and was responsible for the strategy development for Global Services, including services assets initiatives and acquisitions. She served as a Senior Vice President and Group Executive of Sales, Marketing & Strategy at International Business Machines Corp. from 2010 to 2012 and served as its Senior Vice President of Global Sales & Distribution from 2009 to 2010. She was the Senior Vice President of Global Business Services at IBM Business Consulting Services and IBM Global Services (U.S.). She served as the Senior Vice President of Enterprise Business Services-IBM Global Services of International Business Machines Corporation since July 2005 and served as its Senior Vice President of Global Business Services from 2005 to 2009. She served as Managing Partner - IBM Global Business Services of IBM Global Services (U.S.). Mrs. Rometty was the Managing Partner at Business Consulting Services, Inc. Prior to this, she also served as General Manager of IBM Global Business Services, Americas. She was responsible for strategic leadership, operations and client relationships of the Global Services business in the United States, Canada, and Latin America. She also served as General Manager of Strategy, Marketing and Sales Operations for IBM Global Business Services worldwide. Before IBM's services business, Mrs. Rometty served as General Manager of IBM's Global Insurance and Financial Services Sector, where she led IBM's business strategy for the worldwide insurance marketplace, with responsibility for marketing, sales and consulting. She also supervised the operations of IBM's Insurance Research Centers in Hawthorne, N.Y. , Zurich, and Yamaha, and was in charge of IBM's insurance solutions development worldwide. Mrs. Rometty was with General Motors Corporation, where she was responsible for application and systems development. She serves as a Member of IBM's strategy and operations teams. She is a leader in IBM's diversity initiatives, including the Women in Technology Council and the Women's Leadership Council and is one of the Senior Vice President sponsors of the Women's Executive Council at IBM.  Mrs. Rometty has been the Chairman of International Business Machines Corporation since October 1, 2012 and its Director since January 2012. She is a frequent speaker at industry and business conferences around the world, and was named among Fortune Magazine's most influential women in business in 2004, and Time magazine's 2002 Global Business Influential. She serves as Director of APQC, a not-for-profit business research organization serving global companies for 30 years. She served as Director of American International Group, Inc. from September 20, 2006 to May 2009. She holds a Bachelor of Science degree with high honors in Computer Science and Electrical Engineering from Northwestern University. of IBM Business Consulting Services and was responsible for the strategy development for Global Services, including services assets initiatives and acquisitions. Mr. Tough served as the Chief Executive Officer and Managing Director of Ansell Limited from July 1, 2004 to March 1, 2010. column10: Mr. William L. Meaney, BSc, MEng, MSIA, also known as Bill has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Iron Mountain Inc. since January 07, 2013. Mr. Meaney serves as the President and Chief Executive Officer of Iron Mountain Information Management Inc. He served as the Chief Executive Officer of The Zuellig Group, Inc. from 2004 to March 14, 2012. Mr. Meaney has over 20 years experience in a professional management capacity and a proven track record for successfully ... building companies in an international career spanning the United States, Africa, Europe and Asia. Mr. Meaney is the Founder of Genhro Management Consultancy and served as its Managing Director. He served as the Chief Commercial Officer and Managing Director Commerce of Swiss International Air lines Ltd. He served as an Executive Vice President at South African Airways in Johannesburg; the Acting Chief Executive Officer of South African Vaccine Producers (a parastatal pharmaceutical manufacturer based in Johannesburg); and Chief Executive Officer of Star Alliance. column3: Chairman, Chief Executive Officer, Chairman of Executive Committee and Chairman of Finance Committee,
column10: Mr. Alex Gorsky has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Johnson & Johnson since December 28, 2012 and April 26, 2012 respectively. Mr. Gorsky served as the Chief Operating Officer and Head of General Medicines at Novartis Pharmaceuticals Corporation (NPC) from May 2004 to February 2008. He also served as the Chief Executive Officer of Novartis Pharmaceuticals from 2005 to February 2008 and as its Head of Pharma North America since 2005. He was responsible ... for North American pharmaceutical operations of NPC which includes both the United States and Canada. He served as Chief Executive of U.S at Novartis Corporation until February 2008 and Head of USA Pharmaceutical Business at Novartis AG until April 2008. Mr. Gorsky has been the Worldwide Chairman of Surgical Care Group at Johnson & Johnson since January 1, 2009. He served for 15 years in various sales, marketing and management roles with Janssen Pharmaceutica, a Johnson & Johnson unit. He served as the President of Janssen's U.S. operations since 2001. As leader of Janssen's management board, Mr. Gorsky had responsibility for all of its functional areas, including: administration and community affairs; finance; human resources; information management; marketing; medical affairs; public relations; sales and process excellence. He began his pharmaceutical career as a sales representative and held various roles of increasing responsibility in sales, marketing and general management. He also oversaw the launches of Aciphex(R), a proton pump inhibitor for GI disorders, and Reminyl(R), a treatment for Alzheimer's disease. Mr. Gorsky served as Company Group Chairman of for Ethicon Inc. since 2008, Worldwide Chairman of the Surgical Care Group since 2009 and Worldwide Chairman of the Medical Devices and Diagnostics Group since September 2009. He served as Company Group Chairman of Johnson & Johnson's pharmaceutical business in Europe, the Middle East and Africa since 2003. Mr. Gorsky has been a Director of Johnson & Johnson since April 26, 2012. He serves on the board of AdvaMed, the U.S. trade association for the medical device and diagnostics industry. He served for six years in the U.S. Army, finishing his career with the rank of Captain. During that same time, he earned the Ranger Tab, Airborne Wings, and served in Europe, the United States and Panama. His landmark achievements at Janssen include the commercialization of blockbusters Risperdal(R), an atypical anti-psychotic medicine, and Duragesic(R) for pain. A longtime advocate of diversity and inclusion, Mr. Gorsky was named the 2009 Mentor of the Year by the Healthcare Businesswomen's Association. He is an Executive Sponsor of two Johnson & Johnson affinity groups, the Women's Leadership Initiative and the Veteran's Leadership Council. He is actively involved in the National Alliance for the Mentally Ill, the National Alliance on Aging, the Philadelphia College of Pharmacy, the Doylestown Hospital Board, the Boy Scouts of America, and as a Youth League Coach for Lacrosse. Mr. Gorsky holds a Bachelor's of science degree from the U.S. Military Academy in West Point, N.Y., in 1982. He obtained a Master of Business Administration degree from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania in 1996. for North American pharmaceutical operations of NPC which includes both the United States and Canada. column3: Chief Executive Officer,
column10: Mr. Shaygan Kheradpir, Ph.D. has been the Chief Executive Officer of Juniper Networks, Inc since January 01, 2014. Mr. Kheradpir served as the Chief Operations and Technology Officer at Barclays PLC since March 2013. Mr. Kheradpir served as Chief Operating Officer for Retail and Business Banking at Barclays PLC from 2011 to March 2013. He served as Executive Vice President of Verizon Communications Inc. from January 1, 2007 to December 7, 2010 and also served as its ... Chief Technology Officer until December 7, 2010. He joined Barclays, a major global financial services provider, in 2011. While responsible for its operations and technology, he was also a catalyst for the bank's transformation imperatives of 21st century industrialization and customer-focused innovation. He was an original member of the management team when Verizon was created, and through a decade of leadership, was an instrumental member of the team that transitioned Verizon from a regional telephone company to a broadband, media and global communications leader. During his tenure, he helped to create and implement technologies and products that anticipated future market needs such as IP multi-media and Fiber Optic Service (FiOS). Mr. Kheradpir served as the Chief Information Officer of Verizon Communications Inc. since January 1, 2007. Mr. Kheradpir was responsible for the information technology initiatives of all Verizon's business units. Prior to this, he served as Senior Vice President and Chief Information Officer for Verizon Telecom, with oversight of all information technology initiatives for Verizon���s Wireline unit. column3: Chief Executive Officer, President, Director, Chief Executive Officer of The Kansas City Southern Railway Company, President of The Kansas City Southern Railway Company and Director of The Kansas City Southern Railway Company,
column10: Mr. David L. Starling has been President and Chief Executive Officer of Kansas City Southern since July 1, 2008 and August 1, 2010 respectively. Mr. Starling serves as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of The Kansas City Southern Railway Company and has been its President since July 01, 2008. Mr. Starling served as the Chief Operating Officer of Kansas City Southern from July 1, 2008 to August 1, 2010. He served as President and Director General of The Panama Canal ... Railway Company (PCRC) since 1999. He headed The Panama Canal Railway, for nine years. Mr. Starling has a 23-year industry career, from helping Mi-Jack create a terminal operating firm to running stack train operations in Chicago and later the southern region for American President Lines, as well as postings in Asia for APL. He has acquired substantial experience in the North American rail industry and in intermodal and global shipping logistics during his career in transportation. He began his railroad career in 1971 with the St. Louis-San Francisco Railroad (the Frisco) and for 14 years held various positions in rail operations at the Frisco and later Burlington Northern (BN) when the Frisco was merged into BN. In 1984, Mr. Starling joined Mi-Jack Products to help create a terminal operating company, In-Terminal Services (ITS), as General Manager. He served as Vice President of ITS and launched an aggressive marketing strategy resulting in very rapid growth over a four year period. In 1988, he joined American President Lines (APL) as Managing Director of stack train operations for the Chicago region and later the Southern region, where he was heavily involved with the implementation of dedicated double stack trains from the Detroit area to Hermosillo, Mexico for Ford, to Monterrey, Mexico for General Motors and to Toluca, Mexico for Chrysler. From 1993 to 1994, he served as Managing Director of the Philippines for APL and was responsible for all regional functions including financial, legal and governmental relations. Since 1995, he served as APL's Managing Director for Hong Kong/South China region and served as its Vice President of Central Asia responsible for China, Taiwan and Hong Kong. He serves as Chairman of Kansas City Southern de Mexico, S. de R.L. de C.V. and also served as its Vice President of the Board of Directors. He serves as Director of Ferrellgas Partners LP. He has been a Director of Kansas City Southern since May 6, 2010 and The Kansas City Southern Railway Company since July 2008. He has been a Director of Ferrellgas, Inc. since February 27, 2014. Railway Company (PCRC) since 1999. He headed The Panama Canal Railway, for nine years. Mr. Starling has a 23-year industry career, from helping Mi-Jack create a terminal operating firm to running stack train operations in Chicago and later the southern region for American President Lines, as well as postings in Asia for APL. He has acquired substantial experience in the North American rail industry and in intermodal and global shipping logistics during his career in transportation. He began his railroad career in 1971 with the St. Louis-San Francisco Railroad (the Frisco) and for 14 years held various positions in rail operations at the Frisco and later Burlington Northern (BN) when the Frisco was merged into BN. In 1984, Mr. Starling joined Mi-Jack Products to help create a terminal operating company, In-Terminal Services (ITS), as General Manager. He served as Vice President of ITS and launched an aggressive marketing strategy resulting in very rapid growth over a four year period. In 1988, he joined American President Lines (APL) as Managing Director of stack train operations for the Chicago region and later the Southern region, where he was heavily involved with the implementation of dedicated double stack trains from the Detroit area to Hermosillo, Mexico for Ford, to Monterrey, Mexico for General Motors and to Toluca, Mexico for Chrysler. From 1993 to 1994, he served as Managing Director of the Philippines for APL and was responsible for all regional functions including financial, legal and governmental relations. Since 1995, he served as APL's Managing Director for Hong Kong/South China region and served as its Vice President of Central Asia responsible for China, Taiwan and Hong Kong. He serves as Chairman of Kansas City Southern de Mexico, S. de R.L. de C.V. and also served as its Vice President of the Board of Directors. He serves as Director of Ferrellgas Partners LP. He has been a Director of Kansas City Southern since May 6, 2010 and The Kansas City Southern Railway Company since July 2008. He has been a Director of Ferrellgas, Inc. since February 27, 2014.

President for pharmaceutical products and corporate development at Eli Lilly and Company since 2001. He served as President - U S operations at Eli Lilly and Company since July 2004. He joined Eli Lilly and Company in 1979 as a senior organic chemist in process research and development, Dr. Lechleiter became head of that department in 1982. He returned to the United States in 1986 as Manager of research and development projects for Europe. Since 1988, he served as Director of Development Projects Management at Lilly, and in 1989, he assumed additional responsibility for pharmaceutical regulatory affairs. column10: Ms. Marillyn A. Hewson has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Lockheed Martin Corporation since January 1, 2013 and its Chairman since January 1, 2014. Ms. Hewson served as Executive Vice President of the Electronic Systems at Lockheed Martin Corporation from January 1, 2010 to January 1, 2013. She served as President of Lockheed Martin's Systems Integration -Owego, a subsidiary at Lockheed Martin Corporation from September 2008 to January 1, 2010. She served as president, Logistics Services for Lockheed Martin Corporation from January 2007 to March 2007. Ms. Hewson served as an Executive Vice President of Global Sustainment of Lockheed Martin Aeronautics Company. from April 2007 to August 2008 where she was responsible for ensuring that customers around the world receive best-value sustainment services and total life cycle support for their aircraft. column10: Mr. Terry J. Lundgren has been the Chief Executive Officer of Macy's, Inc. since February 26, 2003 and has been its President since May 1997. Mr. Lundgren served as the President, Chief Operating Officer and Chief Merchandising Officer of Macy's, Inc. since April 15, 2002. He began his retailing career in 1975 with Bullock's at Macy's, Inc. For 12 years, he served positions of increasing responsibility in buying, human resources, senior-level store management and merchandising. ... He served as an Executive Vice president at Neiman Marcus, where he served as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer since 1988. Mr. Lundgren served as Federated Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of its Merchandising Group and served as its President and Chief Merchandising Officer since 1997 and Chief Operating Officer since 2002. He joined Federated in 1975 and served as its President of Bullock Wilshire operation since 1987. He worked at Federated Department Stores, Inc., Pension Arm. He left Federated in 1988. He was a Broadcast and Cable Television Executive. He serves as a Co-chairman of The Partnership For New York City, Inc. Mr. Lundgren has been the Chairman of Macy's, Inc. since January 15, 2004 and has been its Director since May 1997. He served as Chairman of Federated since 2004 and has been its Director since 1997. He serves as the Chairman of National Retail Federation Inc. He served as the Chairman of National Minority Supplier Development Council Business Consortium Fund, Inc. until October 2012. From February 1994 to February 19, 1998, he served as the Chairman of the Federated Merchandising Group, a division of Federated. He has been a Director of Kraft Foods Group, Inc. since October 1, 2012 and Macy's Inc., since May 1997.
