column3: Chief Executive Officer, President and Director,
column10: Mr. Lee M. Tillman has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Marathon Oil Corporation since August 1, 2013. Mr. Tillman served as a Vice President of Engineering at ExxonMobil Development Company, where he was responsible for all global engineering staff engaged in major project concept selection, front end design and engineering. He began his career in the oil and gas industry at Exxon in 1989 as a Research Engineer. He has extensive operations management ... and leadership experience that has included assignments in Jakarta, Indonesia; Aberdeen, Scotland; Stavanger, Norway; Malabo, Equatorial Guinea; Dallas and New Orleans. Mr. Tillman assumed the position of Operations Superintendant of New Orleans Production Organization in 1998, and was named Operations Manager of Mobil Equatorial Guinea relocating to Malabo, Equatorial Guinea in 2001. In 2003, he moved to Irving, Texas as Upstream Advisor to the ExxonMobil management committee. Relocating to Houston in 2005, he was appointed Offshore Division Manager of ExxonMobil Upstream Research Company. From 2006 to 2007, he served as Acting Vice President of ExxonMobil Upstream Research Company. From 2007 to 2010, he served as North Sea Production Manager and Lead Country Manager at ExxonMobil Upstream Research in Stavanger, Norway. He is a Member of the Society of Petroleum Engineers. Mr. Tillman holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Chemical Engineering with honors from Texas A&M University and a Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering from Auburn University. and leadership experience that has included assignments in Jakarta, Indonesia; Aberdeen, Scotland; Stavanger, Norway; Malabo, Equatorial Guinea; Dallas and New Orleans. Mr. Glaser served as the Chief Operating Officer of Marsh & McLennan Companies, Inc. from April 20, 2011 to December 2012. column3: Chief Executive Officer, Group President and Director,
column10: Mr. Keith J. Allman has been Chief Executive Officer and Group President of Masco Corporation since February 14, 2014. Mr. Allman served as the Group President at Masco Corporation from November 22, 2011 to February 14, 2014 and was responsible for Masco's Plumbing and North American Cabinet businesses. He was responsible for Brasstech, Delta Faucet Company, Hansgrohe, Liberty Hardware, Masco Bath, Masco Canada and Mirolin Industries Corporation. Mr. Allman has experience ... in the automotive and home building industries. He served as the President of Masco Corporation Of Indiana (also known as Delta Faucet Company) from April 9, 2007 to 2011. He joined Masco in 1998 as Vice President of Manufacturing for the Masco 's cabinet maker Merillat Industries. Mr. Allman served as an Executive Vice President of Operations at Masco's Builder Cabinet Group. Prior to joining Masco, he spent 13 years with General Motors in a variety of manufacturing, engineering and quality positions. Following his career at GM, he worked in the automotive tier one supply base in a number of senior leadership positions. Prior to joining Masco, he spent 13 years with General Motors in a variety of manufacturing, engineering and quality positions. column3: Chief Executive Officer, President and Director,
column10: Mr. Ajaypal S. Banga, also known as Ajay has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Mastercard Incorporated since July 1, 2010 and August 31, 2009 respectively. Mr. Banga has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Mondex International Ltd. since July 1, 2010 and August 31, 2009, respectively. He serves as the Chief Executive Officer and President of MasterCard Worldwide, Inc. He served as the Chief Operating Officer of Mastercard Incorporated from ... August 31, 2009 to July 1, 2010. He served as the Chief Operating Officer of Mondex International Ltd. from August 31, 2009 to July 1, 2010. He served as the Chief Operating Officer of MasterCard Worldwide, Inc. He joined MasterCard in 2009. Mr. Banga served as the Chief Executive Officer of Asia Pacific Region at Citibank Singapore Limited, a subsidiary of Citigroup Inc. He served as the Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer of Global Consumer Group, International at Citigroup Finance Canada Inc. from August 2005 to 2008. He spent 13 years at Citibank, where he served as Chief Executive Officer of Citi Asia Pacific and was responsible for all its business lines in the region, including institutional banking, alternative investments, wealth management, consumer banking and credit cards. Mr. Banga served as the Chief Executive Officer of Asia Pacific Region at Citigroup Inc. until June 2009 and Head of Alternative Investments for Asia Pacific Region since August 2008. His responsibilities included all credit card, retail banking, and consumer finance operations in Asia, Japan, Europe/Middle East/Africa, Latin America and Mexico at Citigroup. He also served as the Head of International Consumer Business, New York of Citigroup until August 2008. Mr. Banga served as an Executive Vice President of Global Consumer Group at Citigroup and President of Retail Banking North America since 2002. Since 2002, he had additional responsibility for the servicing and technology of all the real estate businesses in the consumer bank. He was responsible for branch and commercial banking, commercial real estate, commercial financing and leasing, mortgages, student loans, and the Primerica Financial Services distribution channel. Mr. Banga served as the Business Head for CitiFinancial and the US Consumer Assets Division from 2000 to 2002 and as Division Executive for consumer bank in Central/Eastern Europe, Middle East, Africa and India from 1998 to 2000. Mr. Banga began his business career as a Management Trainee at Nestlﾒﾩ, India, where for 13 years he worked on assignments spanning sales, marketing and general management. He spent the next 13 years in a variety of assignments spanning sales, marketing and general management. He also spent two years at Pepsico, where he was instrumental in launching its fast food franchises in India as the economy liberalized. He joined Citifinancial in 1996 as Head of Marketing and Sales in India, and as Head of its Sales, Marketing and Business Development for Europe, Middle East and Africa, based in Brussels. He served as the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Foreign Consumer Business of Citigroup Inc. He was Business Sponsor of Citi's African heritage network, NYC. From 2005 to mid-2009, he spearheaded Citi's strategy in the microfinance sector around the world. Mr. Banga served as Vice Chairman of the New York Hall of Science. He has been a Director of Mastercard Incorporated since April 12, 2010 and The Dow Chemical Company since February 19, 2013. He serves as a Director at MasterCard Worldwide, Inc. He serves as a Trustee of the National Urban League, Enterprise Community Partners and the Asia Society. He serves as a Director of Mondex International Limited. Mr. Banga is a member of the Board of Overseers of the Weill Cornell Medical College. He has served on the board of trustees of the Asia Society, the New York Hall of Science, and among others. He served as a Director of Mondelez International, Inc. from January 2007 to May 23, 2012. He served as a Director for the Council for Economic Education. He served as a Director of Foreign Consumer Business of Citigroup Inc. He served as a Director of Kraft Foods Inc. from January 2007 to May 23, 2012. He is chairman of the U.S.-India Business Council. He is a member of the Council on Foreign Relations, the International Advisory Board of the Moscow School of Management (Skolkovo), The Economic Club of New York, The Financial Services Roundtable and the board of the New York City Ballet. He has a keen interest in social development issues. He was named by The Economic Times of India as the fourth Most Powerful Indian" in the world. He is a fellow of the Foreign Policy Association and was awarded the Foreign Policy Association Medal in 2012. Mr. Banga graduated with a BA in Economics Honors from Delhi University and is an alumnus of the Indian Institute of Management in Ahmedabad

column10: Mr. Bryan G. Stockton has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Mattel, Inc. since January 1, 2013 and January 1, 2012 respectively. Mr. Stockton serves as an Advisor of Toy Industry Association, Inc. Mr. Stockton serves as a Treasurer of Otis College of Art & Design. He served as the Chief Operating Officer of Mattel, Inc. since January 2011, where he was responsible for day-to-day operations of Mattel, which include overseeing the design, development, marketing ... and sale of all Mattel toy brands globally, such as Barbie(R), Hot Wheels(R), American Girl(R) and Fisher-Price(R), as well as licensed entertainment properties. He served as the President of International at Mattel from November 2007 to January 2011. Mr. Stockton was responsible for the marketing and selling of the Fisher-Price and Mattel Brands portfolios outside the United States. He served as an Executive Vice President of International of Mattel, Inc. from February 2003 to November 2007. He served as an Executive Vice President of Business Planning and Development of Mattel from November 2000 to February 2003, where he was responsible for identifying and developing strategic opportunities for Mattel, as well as managing all merger and acquisition activity. Mr. Stockton served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Basic Vegetable Products from April 1998 to November 2000. He held a variety of positions during his 22-year tenure with Kraft Foods, Inc., the largest U.S.-based packaged food company in the world. He served as the President of Kraft's North American FoodService, one of its largest divisions, where he oversaw all aspects of the business and operations, including strategy development, marketing, raw material sourcing and sales from August 1996 to March 1998. column3: Chief Executive Officer, President, Director and Chairman of Executive Committee,
column10: Mr. Donald Thompson, also known as Don, has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of McDonald's Corp. since July 1, 2012 and January 11, 2010 respectively. Mr. Thompson served as the Chief Operating Officer of McDonald's Corp. from January 11, 2010 to June 30, 2012. He served as the President of McDonald's USA, LLC, a subsidiary of McDonald's Corp. and Mcdonald's Restaurants Of Canada Limited from August 23, 2006 to January 11, 2010. He served as the Head of ... National Marketing of the U S business of McDonald's Corp., a holding company of Mcdonald's Restaurants Of Canada Limited. Mr. Thompson served as an Executive Vice President and Chief Operations Officer at McDonald's USA, LLC since January 2005. He has responsibility for the entire U.S.A field, with the three U.S.A Divisions at McDonald. Mr. Thompson served as an Executive Vice President and innovation orchestration leader for McDonald's Restaurant Solutions Group. He was responsible for establishing, integrating and orchestrating McDonald's innovation pipeline to drive the business. He provided system leadership to identify and capitalize on new growth opportunities, including overseeing Mcdonald's Corp. concept development, R&D and menu management functions. He served as President of the West Division for McDonald's. He was responsible for 4,000 restaurants in the western United States. Mr. Thompson also served as the President of the Midwest Division for McDonald's, and was responsible for more than 2,200 restaurants in the Midwestern United States. Prior to that, he served as Senior Vice President, restaurant support officer of the Midwest Division. Prior to the Midwest Division, he served as Regional Vice President for the San Diego Region and was responsible for more than 350 restaurants in Southern California. He began his career with McDonald's in 1990 as a Restaurant Systems Engineer. and also served as Project Manager since 1991 and Staff Director for the quality development department since 1993, and also served as Director of operations for the Denver Region of McDonald. He was an Engineer Specialist in the Defense Systems Division of the Northrop Corporation. He serves as a Director of World Business Chicago. column3: Chairman, Member of Nomination & Remuneration Committee, Chief Executive Officer of Mcgraw Hill Financial and President of Mcgraw Hill Financial,
column10: Mr. Douglas L. Peterson, also known as Doug, has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of McGraw Hill Financial, Inc., since November 1, 2013. Mr. Peterson served as the President of Standard & Poor's Ratings Services at McGraw Hill Financial from 2011 to November 1, 2013. Mr. Peterson served as the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Citibank Japan Ltd. from May 14, 2004 to January 2010. He served as Chief Executive Officer and President of Citigroup Japan ... Holdings Corp. (also known as, Nikko Citi Holdings, Inc. and Citigroup Japan) and served as its Co-Chairman until April 2009. He served as Chief Operating Officer of Citibank, National Association at Citigroup, Inc. (also known as, Citibank N A ) from January 2010 to September 2011. Mr. Peterson served as the Chief Auditor of Citigroup from October 2000 to May 14, 2004. He joined Citibank in 1985 and served as a Relationship Manager in Buenos Aires for two years in the Corporate Bank with local energy companies. He then spent four years in New York as a Relationship Manager covering domestic and international airlines and aircraft manufacturers. In 1991, he moved to Costa Rica as the Country Corporate Officer, where he expanded the franchise by opening the first foreign-owned bank in Costa Rica. From 1995 to 1998, Mr. Peterson was the Country Corporate Officer in Uruguay, where he managed the corporate bank and oversaw Citicorp's mutual fund. He also launched a private pension fund through a joint venture. He oversaw the merger of the audit functions of Citigroup's predecessor companies and then managed audit teams covering the Global Capital Markets, Latin America, and Travelers insurance businesses. He joined Audit and Risk Review in 1998 as a Managing Director and served for two years. During his tenure at Audit and Risk Review, the function earned recognition for the quality of its work and the forward-looking nature of its approach. Mr. Peterson has been the Chairman of CRISIL Limited since October 28, 2011. He has been a Director of McGraw-Hill Financial, Inc. since July 11, 2013. He serves as a Director of Standard & Poor's International, LLC. He served as Independent Director of Nikko Cordial Corporation. He served as a Director of Citibank Japan Ltd. and Citigroup Japan Holdings Corp. He serves on the Boards of Advisors for the Wharton Financial Institutions Center and the Kravis Leadership Institute, and the Board of Trustees of the Paul Taylor Dance Company and Claremont McKenna College. He served on the board of Teaching Matters, Inc. Mr. Peterson served on the boards of the American Chambers of Commerce (in Costa Rica, Uruguay, and Japan), the Uruguayan American School and the International Bankers Association of Japan. He graduated from Claremont McKenna College in 1980 with a B.A. in Mathematics and History. Mr. Peterson received an M.B.A. from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania in 1985, where he concentrated in International Finance. Holdings Corp. column3: Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and President,
column10: Mr. John H. Hammergren has been the Chief Executive Officer and President at McKesson Corporation since April 2001. Mr. Hammergren served as Co-President and Co-Chief Executive Officer of Mckesson Corporation from July 1999 to April 2001. He served as an Executive Vice President of Mckesson Corporation and its President & Chief Executive Officer of the Supply Management Business from January 1999 to July 1999; Group President of McKesson Health Systems from 1997 to 1999 ... and Vice President of Mckesson Corporation since 1996. He served as an Executive Vice President for the pharmaceutical, medical-surgical, pharmacy automation and pharmacy outsourcing businesses of McKesson Corp. Prior to joining McKesson, he led the Medical-Surgical division of Kendall Healthcare Products Company, and held a series of general management positions at Baxter Healthcare Corporation/American Hospital Supply Corporation and Fujisawa Healthcare from 1981 to 1991. He has been the Chairman of McKesson Corporation since July 31, 2002. He serves as a Co-Chairman of Verispan LLC. He has been a Director of McKesson Corporation since July 1999. Mr. Hammergren served as a Director of Hewlett-Packard Company from November 22, 2005 to May 24, 2013. In 2009 and 2010, he served as the Chairman of the Healthcare Leadership Council. He is a Member of the Business Council and Business Roundtable. In addition, he has twice been named one of Modern Healthcare's 100 Most Powerful People in Healthcare. Technologies & Services Business of Cardinal Health, Inc. from December 2004 to October 2006. Prior to joining Actavis, Inc., Mr. Papa served as the President and Chief Operating Officer of DuPont Pharmaceuticals from February 2001 to November 2001. Searle & Company, Novartis AG, Novartis Pharmaceuticals Corp., Ciba Geigy Pharmaceuticals and Geneva Pharmaceuticals. He began his career as a Pharmacist. column3: Chairman, Chief Executive Officer, President, Chairman of Executive Committee, Chairman of PSEG Power LLC, Chairman of Public Service Electric & Gas Company, Chief Executive Officer of PSEG Power LLC and Chief Executive Officer of Public Service Electric & Gas Company,
column10: Dr. Ralph Izzo, Ph.D., has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Public Service Enterprise Group Inc. since April 1, 2007 and has been its President since October 1, 2007. Dr. Izzo has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Public Service Electric and Gas Company (PSE&G) and PSEG Power LLC since April 1, 2007. He has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of PSEG Energy Holdings LLC since July 2008. Dr. Izzo has been an Executive Vice President ... of Exelon Electric & Gas and President of Exelon Energy Delivery at Exelon Corp. since July 2005. He served as Chief Operating Officer of Public Service Enterprise Group Inc. since October 1, 2007. He served as President and Chief Operating Officer of Public Service Electric and Gas Company (PSE&G) a subsidiary of Public Service Enterprise Group Inc. from October 18, 2003 to October 1, 2006. Dr. Izzo served as Vice President, OFlynnto Utility Operations of PSE&G from June 2002 to October 2003. He served as Vice President, Special Projects of PSEG Services Corporation (Services) from September 2001 to June 2002. He served as the President of PSEG Energy Holdings LLC from July 2008 to June 2009. He served as President and Chief Operating Officer of PSEG Energy Holdings LLC since October 1, 2006. He served as Vice President, Appliance Service of PSE&G from April 2000 to September 2001 and also served as Vice President, Corporate Planning of Public Service Enterprise Group Inc. (PSEG) from March 1998 to April 2000. He joined PSE&G in 1992 and was elected to several executive positions within PSEG's family of companies, including PSE&G senior vice president of utility operations. Dr. Izzo serves as the Chairman at New Jersey After 3 Inc. He serves as the Chairman of the Board of Governors and a Member of Board of Trustees at Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey. He has more than 20 years experience as a senior executive in the energy industry. He has been a Director of Public Service Electric & Gas Co (PSE&G) since October 1, 2006 , PSEG Power LLC since October 2006, Public Service Enterprise Group Inc. since October 1, 2006, PSEG Energy Holdings since October 1, 2006, Williams Companies, Inc. since March 14, 2013 and The National Center on Addiction and Substance Abuse at Columbia University since November 16, 2011. He serves on the board of directors at the Electric Power Research Institute, the New Jersey Chamber of Commerce, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center and the New Jersey Utilities Association. He serves on the board of trustees for the Partnership for a Drug-Free New Jersey, Independent College Fund of New Jersey, the Industrial Advisory Group, The College of New Jersey and New Jersey Network. He serves as a director of Edison Electric Institute (EEI), the Nuclear Energy Institute (NEI), the Institute for Nuclear Power Operations (INPO), and The Center for Energy Workforce Development. He is also a member of the Columbia University Engineering Board of Visitors. He served as a Director of American Gas Association. He also serves as Co-chair of the Drumthwacket Foundation, a Member of the Rutgers Business School Board of Trustees, and electric utility Sector Chairman of the Infrastructure Advisory Committee in the Attorney General's Office of Counter-Terrorism. Dr. Izzo is a well-known leader within the utility industry - as well as the public policy arena. His public policy experience includes service as an American Physical Society Congressional Science Fellow, in the office of U.S. Senator Bill Bradley. He also served four years as a senior policy advisor in the Office of New Jersey Governor Thomas H. Kean, specializing in energy, science and technology. Dr. Izzo's career began as a research scientist at the Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory, performing numerical simulations of fusion energy experiments. He has published or presented over 35 papers on magneto hydrodynamic modeling. He is listed in numerous editions of Who's Who and has been the recipient of national fellowships and awards. In addition, he has completed a nuclear reactor technology course for utility executives at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He received Honorary Degrees from the New Jersey Institute of Technology (Doctor of Science), Thomas A. Edison State College (Doctor of Humane Letters),and Bloomfield College (Doctor of Humane Letters). In August 2002, he completed the requirements for a Master of Business Administration degree, with a concentration in finance from the Rutgers Graduate School of Management. He received his Bachelor of Science and Master of Science Degrees in mechanical engineering, and his Doctor of Philosophy degree in applied physics from Columbia University. Mr. Ventura served as an Executive Vice President of Range Resources Corp. since July 2003. He served as the Chief Operating Officer of Range Resources Corp. from July 2003 to January 2012. Mr. Ventura served as President and Chief Operating Officer of Matador Petroleum Corporation from 1997 to 2003. He served ... as Vice President of Exploration and Development of Matador Petroleum Corp. Prior to 1997, Mr. Ventura spent eight years at Maxus Energy Corporation, where he managed engineering and development operations for the Southern Division and was responsible for coordinating engineering technology. Mr. Ventura has 24 years of technical and management experience in the oil and gas industry. He served as a Director of Communications of Maxus, Project Manager for Venezuela and immediately before joining Matador, he served as Manager for Division Engineering and Development Manager of New Ventures and Technology. He is a registered Professional Engineer in the State of Texas and a member of the Society of Petroleum Engineers, the American Association of Petroleum Geologists and the Completion Engineering Association. He is serving a two-year term on the Advisory Board of The Completion Engineering Association and recently completed a three-year term serving on The Society of Petroleum Engineers Committee on Emerging and Peripheral Technology. column10: Mr. William H. Swanson, also known as Bill, serves as the Chief Executive Officer and the Chairman of the Board at Raytheon Technical Services Company LLC. Mr. Swanson serves as the Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer of Raytheon Intelligence and Information Systems. He has been the Chief Executive Officer of Raytheon Co. of Raytheon Systems Limited. since July 01, 2003 and Chairman of the Board since January 28, 2004. He serves as the Chairman and Chief ... Executive Officer of Raytheon Space & Airborne Systems. He serves as the President of Raytheon Southeast Asia Systems Company. At Raytheon, Mr. Swanson heads a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, homeland security and other government markets throughout the world. He served as the President of Raytheon Co. from July 2002 to May 2004. He joined Raytheon in 1972 and has held a wide range of leadership positions across a broad spectrum of Raytheon's business units. He served as an Executive Vice President of Raytheon Company and President of Raytheon���s Electronic Systems segment from January 2000 to July 2002. Mr. Swanson served as the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Raytheon Systems Company from January 1998 to January 2000. He served as General Manager of Raytheon���s Electronic Systems segment from March 1995 to January 1998 and Senior Vice President and General Manager of Missile Systems Division from August 1990 to March 1995. He served as President of Raytheon, responsible for Raytheon's government and defense operations. He has served Raytheon for more than 30 years holding increasingly responsible management positions with Raytheon Co. Mr. Swanson is vice chairman of the Business-Higher Education Forum. He has been a Director of Raytheon Co. since July 1, 2003 and NextEra Energy, Inc. since October 2009. He served as a Director at Sprint Corp. (formerly Sprint Nextel Corp) from September 2004 to May 13, 2008. He served as a Director of Florida Power & Light Company. He served as a Director of Sprint Corp. from September 29, 2004 to August 2005. He served as a Director of Sprint Corp. Fon Group since September 2004. He served as a Director of Sprint Corp. PCS Group since September 29, 2004 and served as its Co-Lead Independent Director. Mr. Swanson is a member of the board of directors of the Medal of Honor Foundation board, the Pepperdine University board of regents, the California Polytechnic State University President's Cabinet, and the Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy Greenway Conservancy board. He serves as a member of the Executive Committee of the Business-Higher Education Forum (BHEF) and is co-chair of BHEF's Initiative on Mathematics and Science Education. Mr. Swanson is also a member of the Secretary of the Air Force Advisory Board and is a trustee of the Association of the U.S. Army. He serves as a member of the National Defense Industrial Association, the Navy League, the Air Force Association and the board of governors of the Aerospace Industries Association. He is a member of the CIA Officers Memorial Foundation board of advisors, a fellow of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics, and a member of the President's National Security Telecommunications Advisory Committee. Mr. Swanson is a member of the Congressional Medal of Honor Foundation board and the John F. Kennedy Library Foundation board of directors. He received a Woodrow Wilson Award for Corporate Citizenship. In 2002, he received the Semper Fidelis Award from the U.S. Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation. In 2003, he received the Aviation Week & Space Technology Laurel Award for significant contributions" to the field of Aeronautics/Propulsion. He was also named the "California Manufacturer of the Year" by the California Manufacturing & Technology Association and a fellow of the Royal Aeronautical Society (United Kingdom). Mr. Swanson has received the Navy League Rear Admiral John J. Bergen Leadership Medal for Industry

Mr. Newman holds a Bachelor of Science in Petroleum Engineering from the Colorado School of Mines in 1989 and an MBA from the Harvard University Graduate School of Business in 1992.

Ms. Cafaro was a Founding Member at Barack Ferrazzano in Chicago, ... where she practiced real estate, corporate, and finance law for 13 years. She was the First Vice Chair of NAREIT for 2008-2009. She is admitted to the Bar in Illinois and Pennsylvania. Ms. Cafaro is a Member of the Visiting Committee of the University of Chicago Law School and a Chapter Director of the National Association of Corporate Directors. She was an Adjunct Professor of Law at Northwestern University Law School from 1988 to 1992. In 2011
column18: she was named one of the Top 25 Women in Healthcare by Modern Healthcare and one of the Women to Watch by Crain's Chicago Business. She was also voted to Institutional Investor's "2011 All-American Executive Team." In 2010
column19: Forbes named Ms. Cafaro one of the ten "Best CEOs." She was also a recipient of the Aiming High Award from Legal Momentum
column20: which recognizes remarkable women whose personal leadership has broken new ground for women in business (2009). Ms. Cafaro has been named an Outstanding Woman by National Real Estate Investor Magazine (2008); a Woman of Influence by Real Estate Forum (2008); Female Leader of the Year by Commercial Property News (2007); one of "50 Women to Watch" by the Wall Street Journal (2004); and one of the "Best of the Best" REIT CEOs (2003). She received her J.D. cum laude from the University of Chicago Law School in 1982 and B.A. magna cum laude from the University of Notre Dame in 1979."

column3: Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of The Verizon Wireless,
column10: Mr. Lowell C. McAdam has been Chairman of Verizon Communications Inc., since January 1, 2012 and its Chief Executive Officer since August 1, 2011. Mr. McAdam served as President of Verizon Communications Inc. since October 1, 2010. He served as the Chief Operating Officer at Verizon Communications Inc. since October 1, 2010. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Verizon Wireless, a Joint Venture of Verizon Communications Inc. from January 1, 2007 ... to October 1, 2010. He served as an Executive Vice President of Verizon Communications Inc. until October 1, 2010. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Cellco Partnership until October 01, 2010. He served as the President and Chief Executive Officer of PrimeCo Personal Communications, a joint venture owned by Bell Atlantic and Vodafone AirTouch from 1997 to 2000. Mr. McAdam served as the Chief Operating Officer and Executive Vice President of PrimeCo from 1994 to 1997, where he was responsible for overseeing the build, deployment and successful launch of its customer service operations and all-digital network. He served as the Chief Operating Officer and Executive Vice President of Cellco Partnership since April 2000. Mr. McAdam served as a Vice President of International Operations at AirTouch Communications and was lead technical partner for cellular ventures in Spain, Portugal, Sweden, Italy, Korea and Japan. He joined AirTouch as Executive Director of international applications and operations in 1993. column3: Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and President,
column10: Dr. Jeffrey M. Leiden, M.D., Ph.D. has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Vertex Pharmaceuticals Inc. since February 1, 2012. Dr. Leiden has been Managing Director of Clarus Ventures since 2007. Dr. Leiden joined Clarus Ventures in November 1, 2006 as a Partner. Dr. Leiden has more than 20 years of experience in the biomedical and pharmaceutical sectors. He served as President and Chief Operating Officer at Abbott Laboratories Pharmaceutical Products Group ... in 2001. Dr. Leiden served as an Executive Vice President, Pharmaceuticals and Chief Scientific Officer from 2000 to 2001 at Abbott Laboratories. During his academic career, he was involved in starting several biotechnology companies including Vical and Cardiogene Therapeutics Inc. From 1987 to 2000, Dr. Leiden served several academic appointments including the Chief of Cardiology and Director of the Cardiovascular Research Institute at the University of Chicago at University of Chicago School of Medicine. From July 1999 to July 2000, he served as an Elkan R. Blout Professor of Biological Sciences, Harvard School of Public Health and Professor of Medicine, Harvard Medical School. From 1992 to July 1999, Dr. Leiden was the Frederick H. Rawson Professor of Medicine and Pathology. He has been Chairman of Vertex Pharmaceuticals Inc. since May 2012.  Dr. Leiden has been Chairman of the Board of Directors of VBI Vaccines. Dr. Leiden served as Chairman of the Board of Directors of Lycera Corp. Dr. Leiden served as Chairman of the Board of Directors of TYRX, Inc. (formerly TyRx Pharma, Inc.) since February 28, 2008. He served as Vice Chairman of Shire plc from April 2009 to January 31, 2012. Dr. Leiden has been a Director of Biolex Therapeutics, Inc. since October 2008. He serves as Director of Catabasis Pharmaceuticals. He has been a Director of Abbott Laboratories since 1999. Dr. Leiden has been a Director of Vertex Pharmaceuticals Incorporated, since July 7, 2009. He served as a Non-Executive Director of the Board of Shire plc from January 1, 2007 to January 31, 2012. He served as a Director of TYRX, Inc. since February 2008. He served as Member of the Scientific Advisory Board at Massachusetts Life Sciences Center until September 30, 2011. He served as an Independent Director of Millennium Pharmaceuticals Inc. since October 4, 2007. He served as Director of TAP Pharmaceutical Products Inc. Dr. Leiden serves as a Member of the Board of Trustees of the Ravinia Festival, the Museum of Science and Industry, the Keystone Symposia, and the Penn Medicine Board of the University of Pennsylvania. He also serves as the Chairman at the University of Pennsylvania, School of Medicine. Dr. Leiden serves as a Member of the American Society of Clinical Investigation and the American Association of Physicians. In 2001, he was elected a fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences and Member of the Institute of Medicine of the National Academy of Sciences. During his 14 year career in academia, Dr. Leiden published more than 130 peer reviewed papers. Dr. Leiden earned both, an M.D. and a Ph.D. from the University of Chicago. He has also received an honorary M.A. from Harvard University. Dr. Leiden earned a bachelor's degree in biological sciences from the University of Chicago. in 2001. column3: Chairman, Chief Executive Officer, President and Member of Executive Committee,
column10: Mr. Robert A. Iger, also known as Bob, has been the Chief Executive Officer and President at The Walt Disney Company since October 2, 2005 and has been its Chairman since March 13, 2012. He served as the Chief Operating Officer of The Walt Disney Company from January 2000 to September 2005 and its President since January 2000. He served as the President of Walt Disney International and Chairman of the ABC Group from February 1999 to January 2000. He held a number of ... increasingly responsible positions at ABC, Inc. and its predecessor Capital Cities/ ABC, Inc., culminating in service as the President and Chief Operating Officer of ABC, Inc. from 1994 to 1999. He officially joined the Disney senior management team in 1996 as Chairman of the Disney-owned ABC Group. He began his career at ABC in 1974 as a Studio Supervisor in New York, then moved to ABC Sports, where he advanced over a 12-year period through a series of increasingly responsible management posts. Mr. Iger has held a series of increasingly responsible senior management positions at ABC, where he guided the complex merger of ABC at The Walt Disney Company. He served as Vice President of Programming and was responsible for all scheduling and program acquisitions at ABC Sports since 1987. He served as the President of ABC Entertainment in Los Angeles. He served as the President of the ABC Television Network Group in New York since 1993. During his years at ABC, he oversaw its broadcast television network and station, cable television, radio and publishing businesses, which includes the market leading brands of ABC, ESPN, Lifetime, A&E and The History Channel. He served as the Chief Executive Officer of MarketWatch, Inc. since 2006. He was employed at ABC Holding Company, Inc. He served as the Chairman of the Disney-owned ABC Group since 1996. Mr. Iger has been a Director of The Walt Disney Co. since 2000. He has been an Independent Director of Apple Inc. since November 2011. He has been a Board Member of the U.S.-China Business Council in June 2011. He is also a Member of the Partnership for a New American Economy, a coalition of mayors and business leaders from across the United States that support comprehensive immigration reform. He serves as a Director of National September 11 Memorial & Museum at the World Trade Center Foundation, Inc., Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts Inc., and New York City Outward Bound. In June 2010, he was appointed as U.S. President's Export Council, which advises the U.S. president on how to promote U.S. exports, jobs and growth. He serves as a Trustee of the Museum of Television and Radio of Ithaca College. Mr. Iger serves as a Trustee of American Film Institute. He serves as a Member of Foundation Committee at The Motion Picture and Television Fund. He serves on the Executive Advisory Board of the Elizabeth Glaser Pediatric AIDS Foundation. He served as a Director of ABC, Inc. (formerly Capital Cities/ABC Inc.) since 1994 and Infoseek Corp., since November 1998. He was employed at ESPN Holding Company, Inc. He has been named one of Fortune magazine's ﾊﾗﾓ25 Most Powerful People in Businessﾊﾗﾓ (2006, 2007); one of the ﾊﾗﾓTop Gun CEOsﾊﾗﾓ by Forbes magazine (2009) and one of the ﾊﾗﾓBest CEOsﾊﾗﾓ by Institutional Investor magazine (2008, 2009, 2010, 2011). He graduated magna cum laude. Mr. Iger holds a BS in Communications from Ithaca College. increasingly responsible positions at ABC, Inc. and its predecessor Capital Cities/ ABC, Inc., culminating in service as the President and Chief Operating Officer of ABC, Inc. from 1994 to 1999. column10: Mr. Joseph R. Swedish, known as Joe, has been the Chief Executive Officer of WellPoint Inc. since March 25, 2013. Mr. Swedish serves as an Advisor of China Health Care Corporation. He served as the President and Chief Executive Officer of Trinity Health Corporation since December 2004. He served as President and Chief Executive Officer of Centura Health Inc. from January 1999 to January 2005. Since joining Centura Health in 1999, Mr. Swedish has focused his efforts on ... ensuring the financial stability and service excellence of its core operations. From March 1994 to January 1999, he served as President and Chief Executive Officer of the East Florida Division of Columbia and Central Florida Division at HCA Healthcare Corporation (Hospital Corporation of America). Mr. Swedish has been a Director of WellPoint Inc. since March 25, 2013, Trinity Health Corporation since January 2005 and of Cross Country Inc. since October 2001. He serves as a Trustee at Loyola University of Chicago. Mr. Swedish has more than 40 years of diverse executive healthcare leadership experience to WellPoint, including 24 years serving as Chief Executive Officer for major health and hospital systems. Mr. Swedish serves on numerous committees and boards, including the National Quality Forum (NQF) Quality Healthcare Advisory Committee, the National Center of Healthcare Leadership Board, the Health Leadership Council, the Catholic Health Association Board, the Health Sector Advisory Council, the Institute for Diversity in Healthcare Management Board, and the Catholic CEO Healthcare Connection. column3: Chairman and Chief Executive Officer,
column10: Ms. Ursula M. Burns has been Chief Executive Officer of Xerox Corp. since July 2009 and its Chairman since May 20, 2010. Ms. Burns served as the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Catalyst, Inc. and serves as its Director. She served as the President of Xerox Corp. from April 3, 2007 to July 2009. She served as a Senior Vice President and President of Business Group Operations of Xerox Corp. from December 2002 to April 2007 and its Corporate Senior Vice President ... from April 2000 to April 3, 2007. She joined Xerox in 1980 as a Mechanical Engineering summer intern, where she was responsible for global research, engineering, marketing and manufacturing of Xerox technology and supplies. She served as an Executive Assistant to the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Xerox Corporation from 1991 to 1992 and in various other positions at Xerox Corporation from 1982 to 1991. From 1992 to 2000, Ms. Burns served as the Vice President and General Manager of a series of Xerox Businesses, including the Office Color and Facsimile Business, Office Network Copying Business, Work Group Copier Business and Xerox's Departmental Business Unit. She served in following positions at Xerox, Vice President and General Manager of Departmental Business Unit from 1997 to 1999; Senior Vice President of Worldwide Manufacturing and Supply Chain Services from 1999 to 2000; Senior Vice President of Corporate Strategic Services from 2000 to October 2001; and President of Document Systems and Solutions Group from October 2001 to January 2003. She has been a Director of Xerox Corp. since April 3, 2007; Exxon Mobil Corporation since November 27, 2012; American Express Company since January 26, 2004 and Hunt Corporation since 1999. She serves as a Director at Fuji Xerox Co., Ltd and Kennedy Center Corporate Fund. She also serves on the Boards of Directors of the National Association of Manufacturers and the Rochester Business Alliance. She is a Founding Board Director of Change the Equation, which focuses on improving the U.S. education system in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM). She served as a Director of Dames & Moore Group since 1997. She served as a Director of PQ Corporation; Boston Scientific Corp. from 2002 to May 2009 and Banta Corporation from 2002 to December 2003. (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology) Foundation, National Center on Addiction and Substance Abuse at Columbia University, and the National Academy Foundation. She serves as a Trustee of the University of Rochester and MIT Corporation. She is a member of the board of directors of the U.S. Olympic Committee. She is a Member of Executive Committee at The Business Roundtable. In 2010, she was appointed vice chair of the President's Export Council. Ms. Burns received a Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering from Polytechnic Institute of New York in 1980 and a Master of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering from Columbia University in 1981. from April 2000 to April 3, 2007. column10: Mr. Michael S. McGavick, also known as Mike, has been the Chief Executive Officer of XL Group Plc since May 1, 2008 and served as its President. Mr. McGavick served as President of Safeco Corp. since January 30, 2001 and Chairman January 1, 2003. He served as the Chief Executive Officer of Safeco Corp., from January 30, 2005 to August 31, 2005. He served as President and Chief Operating Officer of CNA Agency Market Operations from October 1997 to January 2001, and President ... of CNA���s Commercial Lines group from January 1997 to October 1997, and held a series of executive positions with CNA���s commercial insurance operations from 1995 to October 1997. Mr. McGavick led the development of its P&C business model: offering auto, homeowners and small-business insurance products over a unified sales-and-service platform through a common network of independent distributors. He served as the President and Chief Operating Officer of CNA Financial Corporation's largest operating unit, responsible for the majority of CNA's commercial insurance business. In addition, he engineered CNA's e-commerce strategy. He served as lead negotiator for the insurance industry with Congress, federal agencies and groups concerned about reform of the nation's Superfund laws. Before that, Mr. McGavick held a series of public affairs positions, including: Partner with The Gallatin Group, a Seattle public affairs firm, from 1991 to 1992; Chief of Staff for U.S. Senator Slade Gorton from 1989 to 1991, and campaign manager for Gorton's successful comeback campaign in 1988; Vice President of the Washington Roundtable, a research group composed of the top executives of Washington state's largest corporations, from 1986 to 1988; and Vice President of The Rockey Company, a Seattle-based public affairs firm. He has been a Director of XL Group plc, since April 2008. He served as a Director of Safeco Corp., since January 30, 2001 and Superfund Improvement Project for the American Insurance Association from 1992 to 1995. column5: The Board of Trustees of The Leland Stanford Junior University
column10: Ms. Marissa A. Mayer has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Yahoo! Inc at Yahoo! UK Limited since July 17, 2012. Ms. Mayer served as Vice President of Location & Local Services of Google, Inc. from October 12, 2010 to July 16, 2012. She served as Vice President of Search Products & User Experience of Google Inc. She served as Vice President of Google Product Search. She served as Vice President of Local and Maps of Google, where she oversaw product management, ... engineering, design and strategy for its suite of local and geographical products, including Google Maps, Google Earth, Zagat, Street View, and local search, for desktop and mobile. She also curated the Google Doodle program, celebrating special events on Google's homepage around the world. During her 13 Years at Google, she served numerous positions, including engineer, designer, product manager and executive, and launched more than 100 well-known features and products. She played an instrumental role in Google search, leading the product management effort for more than 10 years, a period during which Google Search grew from a few hundred thousand to well over a billion searches per day. She led the development of some of Google's most successful services including image, book and product search, toolbar, and iGoogle, and defined such pivotal products as Google News and Gmail. Ms. Mayer is listed as an inventor on several patents in artificial intelligence and interface design. She joined Google as first female engineer in 1999 and played an important role in developing Google's culture. Her contributions included overseeing the look-and-feel of Google's iconic homepage and founding the Associate Product Manager program, which has hired over 300 of Google's future leaders and is considered the industry's ideal standard in transforming new computer science graduates into executive leaders. Prior to Google, she served at the UBS research lab in Zurich, Switzerland and at SRI International in Menlo Park, California. She has been a Director at Aliph, Inc. since May 1, 2013. She has been a Director at Wal-Mart Stores Inc. since 2012 and Yahoo! Inc. since July 17, 2012. She serves as a Director of San Francisco Museum of Modern Art and the New York City Ballet, Inc. She serves as a Trustee of San Francisco Ballet Association. She has been a Member of Executive Council at TechNet since March 14, 2013. She has been honored with the Matrix Award by the New York Women in Communications, as a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum, and as Woman of the Year" by Glamour magazine. Fortune has named Ms. Mayer one of the 50 Most Powerful Women in Business

He has been an Independent Director of Questar Corporation since 1992, Simmons Family Foundation ( a/k/a Simmons Media Group Inc.) since 1977 and Zions BanCorp. since 1989. He serves as a Director of O. C. Tanner Company, Zions Financial Corp., National Life Group, NetDeposit, LLC, National Bank of Arizona and Nevada State Bank. He has been a Director of National Life Insurance Company since 2007. He serves as a Director of The Commerce Bank of Washington, National Association. He serves as Director at National Life Holding Company. He serves as Director of Amegy Bank National Association. He served as a Director of Questar Gas Company. He is active in community affairs in the Salt Lake City area. He is a Member of the Financial Services Roundtable. He serves as President of the Shelter-the-Homeless Committee and Chairs the capital campaign for the Great Salt Lake Council of The Boy Scouts of America. He is a graduate of the Harvard Business School. Mr. Simmons holds B.A. degree of magna cum laude in Economics from the University of Utah and an M.B.A. Degree from Harvard Business School, emphasis in Finance.

He has 35 years of experience of growing responsibility in finance, sales and management, including 15 years in the pharmaceutical industry. Previously, Mr. Alaix served as Regional President of Central/Southern ... Europe of Pfizer Global Pharmaceuticals since 2003. He joined Pfizer from Pharmacia in 2003.
